loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 47-year-old married father of five children who has been working as a car mechanic for sixteen years. He is a Palestinian Refugee, living and working in a Palestinian refugee camp with limited access to several working sectors.

Jalal is acquiring his thirteenth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy some necessary things he needs to develop his business, since he provides car mechanic services. He also sells used spare parts for cars, which is an additional income business helpful to support his family's income and cover their needs. Jalal hopes to expand his business in the future so that he can cover his family's needs since four of his children are enrolled in a public school.

loans.use: To buy necessary things for his car mechanic business

loans.name: Griselda Elizabeth

texts.es: Griselda de 22 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijas de 4 años y 1 año de edad.  Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo visionaria. Griselda se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y va sacando adelante a sus hijas. Habita en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes ya que no posee los recursos para mejorar su vivienda. Su deseo de superación y dar mejores condiciones a sus pequeñas hijas la llevaron a decidirse por solicitar este crédito a FUSAI, para invertir en la reparación  de la cubierta del techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra dañado y cuando llueve se mojan sus pocas pertenencias. Con el crédito comprará la lámina galvanizada, madera y los clavos para sujetar toda la nueva cubierta.
texts.en: Griselda, who is 22, is the single mother of 2 daughters aged 4 and 1.  She is known as a hardworking, responsible and, above all, visionary woman.  Griselda works offering domestic services which enables her to support her family and raise her daughters.  She lives in very humble and modest circumstances as she does not have the resources to improve her home.  Her drive to succeed and provide better living conditions for her small daughters led her to decide to apply to FUSAI for this loan to have her home's roof covering repaired as it is currently damaged and her few possessions get wet when it rains.  She will use the loan to buy galvanised sheeting, wood and nails to hold all the new covering in place.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, wood and nails to repair her roof covering.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a woman who works hard to support her family. The previous loan helped her to buy bricks for sale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy two lorries of bricks for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy two lorries of bricks for resale.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in Gyumri town with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. He has been providing transportation of stones from Gyumri to Yerevan. He transports stones using his own truck. Due to his hard work, Artak is a very important partner for the local stone company and they value his tireless work. 

Currently the engine of his truck is damaged and needs to be renovated. He has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new tires and renovate the engine. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artak and he will be able to continue his work.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck engine and new tires

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free Port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Marie is 45 years old, married with six children between 12 and 26 years old, who live at home and are in school. Marie stopped school in 6th grade.

Marie runs a table selling fresh fish.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 20 years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  Typically, she works 7 am to 5 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as not enough working capital.  She is proud of her business because it support her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more fresh fish for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free Port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Helena is 32 years old, single, with three children aged from 6 to 17, who are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been operating a small table market where she sells fresh fish and chicken in the local market. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with the few goods she could afford, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish and chicken for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish and chicken for her business

loans.name: Group 6 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en: Oanh, 39, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 700,000. She is married with four children: two school-aged children and two small children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995. Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. Those facilities would also help her family improve health, living conditions, afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environment protection of the community. In the picture, Oanh is standing in the front row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shela’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shela has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 for her husband; he wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. 

This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Shela is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kahtreen

texts.en: Kahtreen is a 39-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es: Glenda de 36 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años y habita en casa propia junto a ellos y su compañero de vida.  Desde hace 6 años trabaja como empleada doméstica y de esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes y desea mejorarlas poco a poco. Desea invertir en la construcción de una fosa séptica y en la instalación de la energía eléctrica pero no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso pero si con la capacidad de pago para hacer frente a un financiamiento; razón por la cual se presentó a FUSAI para solicitar dicho financiamiento. Con el crédito comprará ladrillo, cemento, grava e instalará la energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Glenda, 36, is the mother of three children, ages 17, 14, and 11.  She lives in her own house with them and her life partner.  She has worked as a housekeeper for six years; this is how she earns a living and helps with the household expenses.

Glenda wants to improve her modest living conditions little by little.  She wants to build a septic tank and install electricity but she doesn't have the disposable capital for the expense.  She can do it with financing, however, so she went to FUSAI for a loan.

With the loan she'll buy bricks, cement, and gravel, and install electricity.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and to install electricity

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es: Noemy de 41 años es madre soltera y reside en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar constituido por su hermana, madre y sus dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad. Desde hace 6 años trabaja como vendedora de hortalizas y vegetales en las principales zonas de su localidad esto le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy sencillas pero poco a poco va mejorando parte por parte. En esta ocasión desea construir cuarto para ducha ya que el que tiene esta hecho a base de lámina la cual necesita cambio. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para construirlo lo antes posible, con ese crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que no posee el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta, pero confía que con lo que gana de su negocio podrá pagar las cuotas mensuales que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Noemy is 41 and a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children, who are 20 and 14, and her sister and her mother. Noemy has for six years worked selling vegetables in the main sections of her town to generate the income she needs to meet her household expenses. 

Noemy's home is very humble, but she is improving it bit by bit. She wants to install a new shower, as the existing one is merely sheeting and needs to be replaced. Noemy is applying for a loan from FUSAI [Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral - Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to install the shower as soon as possible. Noemy will use the loan to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails. She hopes that she can rely on the loan as she lacks the capital to make these purchases herself. Noemy is confident that the income from her business will allow her to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails for the installation of a shower.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Elizabeth from Liberia. To be precise, she lives in New Kru town with her three children who are attending school and are between the ages of 7 and 13. She stopped school herself in the 8th grade. Over the past five years she has been operating a booth where she sells scratch cards and charges phone. She makes lots of profit, but most of her profit is used on gasoline expenses for her generator. 

Elizabeth started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this way of selling from her boyfriend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more scratch-cards (phone-credit-cards) and gasoline for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more scratch-cards (phone-credit-cards) and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en: Bashira, 42, is a married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 30,000 PKR which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. Bashira wishes to use part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 24-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store business with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 3 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her general store

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta lives in New Kru town. She is 33 years old and married; her husband is a local businessman. They have three children between 10 and 22 who are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market from a shop. She started this business with a loan from her friends and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Hawa is 26 years old, and married with four children between 1 month old to 10 years old. Only three are in school and they all live at home. For the past four years she has been operating a small shop where she sells coal, red oil, pepper, salt, vegetable-cooking-oil, etc. She says sometimes sales are slow. Hawa says she started this business by selling for her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business; her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Penuel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavene est  une commerçante depuis 4 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires « Penuel », âgée de 26 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse  de souliers. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 60 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un Maitre cuisinier. Elle avait commence son commerce avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima en soutenant les femmes entrepreneurs dans les affaires tout en leur accordant des crédits pendant ce moment de conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kavene, age 26, is a member of Penuel Group. She's been a merchant for four years. She's the mother of two young children. She sells shoes.

She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business. She will buy 60 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a master chef.

She started her business with funds she got from her husband. In the future, she would like to buy a land lot and send her children to school.

She thanks Hekima for supporting the businesses of female entrepreneurs by granting them loans during this time of war in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Group 3 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Duyen, 37, is married with four children: two school-aged children and two small children. She and her husband work in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 1,400,000. 

She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2001. Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded. With a portion of this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environment protection of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Duyen is standing in the front row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 4 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Tra, 51, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 710,000. She is married with two grown-up children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1982. 

Her family is currently using a double-pit latrine which is now degraded and has the risks of potential adverse affects to the health of her family members, her community, and environment contamination. 

With a portion of this loan, she will be able to buy materials to build a hygienic septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. 

Those facilities would also help her family improve their health, living conditions, and afford safety for them, particularly at night and during rainstorms, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness, and privacy for all family members, while contributing to the environment protection of the community. 

In the picture, Ms. Tra is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Group 5 - Tân Việt 01

texts.en:
Ms. Yen, 34, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about 720,000 VND. She is married with one small child. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2000. 

Ms. Yen is fully aware that an unhygienic latrine will contaminate the environment as well as adversely affect the health of her family members in particular and her community in general. Due to a lack of funds, her family currently does not have a septic tank latrine.
 
With a portion of this loan, Ms. Yen will build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap to improve her family's living conditions, in addition to providing convenience, cleanliness and privacy for all family members while contributing to environmental protection. 

In the picture, she is standing in the front row, first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en: Nasra is a 51-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nasra’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nasra has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nasra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 22-year-old vigorous lady; she is running a business stitching clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloths in her community. 

Currently, Balqees has taken her third loan of 35,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 36-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has five buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life.

She has six children; two of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa es madre de cuatro hijos, de 18 años, 16, años, 13, años y 14 años de edad. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Teresa se gana la vida como empelada doméstica desde hace muchos años. Este trabajo es su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma junto con su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Su vivienda es muy humilde a base de láminas y palmas de coco las cuales se encuentran deterioradas a causa de las lluvias. Por  lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar las paredes de la vivienda y dar mayor seguridad  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa's the mother of four children, ages 18, 16, 13, and 14.  She and her life partner and children live in very humble conditions.  Teresa has earned a living as a housekeeper for many years.  This job is her main source of income and the way she and her husband cover the household expenses.

Her very modest home is built of metal sheeting and coconut fronds, which have deteriorated from the rain.  This is why she's requesting this loan from FUSAI.

Teresa's going to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the walls and give her children greater security.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house

loans.name: Elsa Antonia

texts.es: Elsa de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14 años, 12 años, 9 años y 5 años de edad. Elsa es casada pero su esposo emigro al extranjero hace algunos años en busca de mejores condiciones de vida razón por la cual ella es la responsable del hogar que con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante. Hace tres años logró establecer una pequeña Pupusería en su hogar de residencia ya que lo que percibe del ingreso de su esposo no le alcanza a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Desea hacer un pequeño cuarto para cubrir su área de lavado y darle mayor seguridad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 36 and lives in her own home with her four children, ages 14, 12, 9, and 5. Elsa is married, but her husband went abroad a few years ago in search of better conditions. Elsa has since been the head of the household and has worked very hard to provide for her family. 

Elsa set up a small tortilla business in her home three years ago because the earnings her husband sent back didn't cover household expenses. Elsa wants to add a small room onto her home that will cover her washing area and provide greater security. She is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI [Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral - Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails to add on a small room.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past eight years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his wood products/charcoal business, which sells charcoal and firewood. To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to fill a capital gap and buy more charcoal, and it will help Joseph to generate greater profits and expand his business, and thus to pay his child's school fees. Joseph hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a bigger business. Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for smaller microloans.

loans.use: to fill his capital shortage and buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her grocery and stationery shop. 

To help to expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock and will help Annet to generate greater profits to improve the wellbeing of her family. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business further. 

Annet is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en: Dorine is returning to Yehu Microfinance for a second loan. She offers thanks for her previous loan, as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits. With the new loan, she wants to buy spare parts to repair phones. She dreams of establishing another business in the future, and she appreciates the support

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair phones.

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet has been involved in flower retail business. From the rented space in one of the central spaces of Gyumri town, Karapet, for over 10 years, has been trading with flowers. Due to his kind attitude toward people and enthusiasm, local people prefer to purchase flowers from Karapet. Karapet lives with his parents, brother and wife. He works hard to cover family's daily costs and provide them better living conditions. 

He has requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of flowers and baskets for designing compositions with them. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Karapet to have new stock of flowers and be prepared for coming New Year holidays.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of flowers, and baskets for designing compositions with flowers

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers frequent. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat for her business. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a  30-year-old married woman and the mother of one. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past seven years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a supply of threads in different colors, along with packets of zippers and buttons, so she can meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a supply of threads in different colors, along with packets of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 46-year-old married woman who has been in business selling milk for many years. She has two calves and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to permit her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She is highly motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day living expenses. This is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with the Foundation’s support. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy another cow. She hopes to increase in her milk  production capacity, which will ultimately help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy another cow for her milk and butter business.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en: Yassah lives in New Kru town. She is 38 years old, single, and has three children from 6 to 19 who live at home and are in school. For the past four years, she has been operating a table business where she sells soft drinks from a cooler. She says sales have been slow for some time. Yassah says she started this business by going around selling in nearby communities, with the small stock of goods she could afford.  She learned this sales technique from her friends. She is applying for a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Setina's Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Teshie, a poor urban area in the Republic of Ghana. Setina lives with her mother long-term. Trading is one of the main economic activities in Accra-Teshie.

Setina is an excellent ID-Ghana client and has successfully repaid six loans. With this seventh loan amount request of 800 GHS, she plans to buy more underwear to sell in her community. Using the proceeds from her business, Setina has been able to purchase clothing and food for her family.

Her dream for the future is to continue to educate her sibling and improve her family's life. Setina thanks you for your support to help her achieve her goals!

Together the group needs a total amount of 3000 GHS to improve the sale of fish, 'kenkey' and underwear.

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell in her community.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has five buffaloes in milk, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Salma has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her third loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees]. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Salma is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is been in the beauty parlor business for three years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She wants to provide more for her customers and attract new customers. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. So she applied a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling clothing. She purchases a variety of clothing from a wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her locality. She has become famous for selling good quality clothing in her community. 

Nighat requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time, which helps in generating more income for her. 

She dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo, ella continua con la venta de ropa como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas, casacas, blusas, polos y otros cosas más, ella continua participando en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar casacas y chompas porque se está acercando la campaña navideña y año nuevo, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Albina thanks all the lenders for her loan and is happy with this support.  She continues to sell clothes, such as jumpers, trousers, shirts, coats, blouses, t-shirts, and more.  Albina is still part of the "Señor de Coyllority" communal bank and, on this occasion, needs a loan to buy coats and jumpers because Christmas and New Year are approaching.  Albina is grateful for and knows the value of this loan.  She promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy coats and jumpers.

loans.name: Prosperos

texts.es:
El señor Prósperos es una persona emprendedora honesta y seria, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Don Prósperos el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  reses.  Con el préstamo  espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos  y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia.  
Don Prósperos  su deseo es que  en unos 2 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  y con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Mr. Prósperos s an honest, serious, hardworking person. He lives with his wife and two children in southern Honduras. His business is buying and selling cattle.

He needs a loan to buy cattle. With the loan he hopes that his sales will increase upon having more merchandise to offer his customers and cover his expenses, and in this way improve his family's economic situation.

Don Prósperos wishes that in 2 years his business continues growing and becomes the biggest and well-known in the area, and that he will continue supporting his family, and that his children finish school and become honest people with principles and values. Choluteca, Honduras - November 2013.







Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del 2013

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: Yony agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo, ella sigue viviendo en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo y continua sacando adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella permanece vendiendo carne en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella continua participando en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más carne de cordero, pescado, res y pollo, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Yony thanks the investors for the loan and she is happy for the support. She continues living in the beautiful city of Paucartambo and continues supporting her family with the efforts of her work. She sells meat in on of the markets in Paucartambo city, and continues participating in the “Señor de Coyllority”  community bank. Today she needs a loan in order to buy more lamb, fish, chicken and beef. She is grateful and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy more lamb, fish, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Veris

texts.es: Veris tiene 53 años y se dedica al comercio en general, actividad con la que ha generado ingresos junto a su cónyuge para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia en la cual existen 3 hijos en las edades de 15, 21 y 24 años. Desde hace 33 años inició su negocio, de la mano de su tía cuando Veris cumplía su mayoría de edad aproximadamente. Su oferta comercial, incluye ropa exterior e interior, artículos para el hogar, calzado, variedades y muchos más artículos domésticos,  que por encargo solicitan sus clientes. Veris trabaja en la venta 4 horas diarias, ofrece a sus compradores alternativas de crédito y contado,  ajustándose a las posibilidades de su mercado. Las compras las realiza en empresas especializadas en cada línea de producto, de contado y algunas veces a crédito. Su meta es fortalecer cada vez más su negocio, para acrecentar su inversión, porque tiene como gran desafío ganar mucho más para lograr que sus hijos logren una carrera profesional  y alcancen oportunidades de éxito. En la actualidad el capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer compras en mayor volumen, que le permitan preparase para la temporada de navidad y de año nuevo, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa interior, artículos para el hogar, calzado y perfumería, inversión con la cual tendrá mas capital de trabajo, mas ventas , mas clientes y mayores utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Veris is 53 and has sold clothing and various goods for 33 years. Her aunt helped her set up the business when she was just 20 years old. Veris and her husband have three children, ages 15, 21, and 24. The income from Veris's business, together with her husband's earnings, allow the couple to meet the family's expenses. 

Veris sells under and outerwar, shoes, and a great variety of household items that her customers request. She sells her merchandise four days a week, for cash or on credit, and is always adapting to the market. Veris buys her inventory from the specialized companies in each product line, usually paying cash, but sometimes buying on credit. 

Veris's goal is to keep strengthening her business in order to increase her investment. Her major challenge is to increase her income so that her children will be able to have professional careers and opportunities to succeed. Veris's capital is currently insufficient for the larger purchases she needs to make ahead of the Christmas and New Year's holidays. She has therefore applied for a Kiva loan, the first financing she's requested from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, that she will use to purchase underwear, shoes, perfumes, and household items. This investment will result in more working capital, more customers, higher sales, and greater profits, all of these adding up to a successful Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase underwear, shoes, perfumes, and household items.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard used his previous loan to buy maize to sell. He is a 32-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, and, with the income, he has been able to restock his business and to pay school fees for his children. His main hardship is high taxes. Nevertheless, he intends to work hard and to attain his goals of expanding his business to new markets and buying land to grow crops. Richard is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyaminya est une présidente  de l’association d’affaire «Juhudi», senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 53 ans  et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et 2 ont déjà leurs foyers. La cliente est  une vendeuse de pommes de terre. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile.  Son conjoint est un chômeur, toute fois, il réalise occasionnellement de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelle et contrat de bail.  La cliente commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard , elle bénéficia le projet Hekima (le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima). Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre.  Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et scolariser ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Nyaminya, age 53, is the president of Juhudi Group. She's an energetic senior entrepreneur with lots of experience. She's the mother of ten children who all go to school. Two of them live in their own household.

Nyaminya sells potatoes. She sets up her products at her home. He husband is unemployed, however he occasionally makes some commissions on land lots sales and lease agreements.

Nyaminya started her business with her husband's help. Later on, she benefited from a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima. She's been running her business for ten years.

This new loan will be used to buy four sacks of potatoes. With it, she hopes to expand her business and send her children to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to make women who are excluded by traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical time of war in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of potatoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez is a 41-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming as his main source of income, though he has other sources like teaching and house rentals. He has been in this business for the past fifteen years, and he hopes to attain better standards of living and buy more land for farming. However, he faces challenges of weather changes and soil exhaustion due to over farming.

Perez is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.name: Gabriela Mardey

texts.es: Gabriela Mardey comenzó hace tres años a producir café en un pequeño terreno de su familia. A pesar de llevar poco tiempo en esto, ella ya es socia de la "Unión Regional" y allí vende su café. Para esta cosecha ella necesita de un crédito para poder pagar a los cortadores de café que contratará. Ella espera que en un lapso de 3 años su cosecha aumente debido a que ha ido sembrando planta en las partes en las que no había nada sembrado. Además de producir café Gabriela Mardey trabaja en unas oficinas para así tener un ingreso extra.
texts.en: Three years ago, Gabriela Mardey began producing coffee on a small plot of land that belongs to her family. In spite of the short time she has spent at this, she is already a member of the "Unión Regional," and that is where she sells her coffee. For this harvest, she needs a loan so that she can pay the coffee cortadores [pickers] whom she will hire on contract. She hopes that over the next three years, her harvest will expand, since she has been planting in the areas where nothing had been planted before. In addition to producing coffee, Gabriela Mardey works in some offices in order to have extra income.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her coffee.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 6th loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

Nazira dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colours along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for many years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. 

She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, along with packs of paints in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. She wishes to spend part of revenue to deal with the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, along with packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Please meet 35 year old Mamie from St. Pau Areal, Liberia.  She has 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 15 years old.  Two children are in school and they all live at home. She is married and her husband is an electrician.

St. Paul, located by the sea, is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish.  St. Paul is a suburb located outside Monrovia.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

For the past 15 years, Mamie has owned a business selling cosmetics.  She will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics.  
On average, she works 9 hours per day.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites earning a small income as her biggest challenge.  A favorite part of her business is making a profit.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been in the business of selling milk for many years. She has two cows and one buffalo. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through Kashf Foundation’s support. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the milk production capacity of her business, which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 37 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años y una hija de 20 años de edad. Trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Para ella lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que hace todo lo que esté a su alcance para salir adelante. Su casa es muy humilde construida a base de lámina la cual necesita cambios ya que con la lluvia se ha deteriorado y los corredores de la vivienda necesitan reparación lo antes posible. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para comenzar la reparación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Reina is 37 years old and is the single mother of a 9 year old son and a 20 year old daughter.  She has worked as a housekeeper for a long time and in this way manages to bring home their livelihood.  The most important thing to her is her children.  She does everything in her power to get ahead for them.

Her house is modestly constructed of metal sheeting which needs replaced because the rain has deterioriated it.  The passageways/porch of the house also need repairs as soon as possible.  Therefore she seeks this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized steel, wood, and nails to begin the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 54 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad. Habita en casa propia que con mucho esfuerzo y muy humildemente ha logrado construir. Victoria se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y además está en un programa del gobierno en el cual recibe un ingreso temporal por la prestación de servicios comunitarios y presencia en el aprendizaje de un oficio. Es una mujer admirable ya que no deja de trabajar y buscar oportunidades para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Desea reparar las láminas de la vivienda de su humilde casa ya que se encuentran dañadas a causa del sol, y las lluvias. Solicita este crédito a FUSIA para comprar las láminas y madera necesaria para reparar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Victoria is 54 years old. She is a single mother of two children who are now adults. She lives in her own house that with much effort she has humbly completed construction. Victoria is in domestic services for a living and also is in a government program in which she receives a seasonal income for  community services and presence in an apprenticeship. She is an admirable woman, as she does not stop working and looking for opportunities to improve her living conditions. She wants to repair the metal sheets of her humble home due to damage caused by the sun and rain. She is requesting a loan to FUSIA to buy the sheets and wood necessary to repair the walls of her home.

loans.use: to buy the metal sheets and wood necessary for repair the walls of her home.

loans.name: Catalina Orbelina

texts.es:
La Joven   Catalina  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 5 años.
Catalina  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de churros,  refrescos,  pan, café,  azúcar, maíz,  frijoles, etc. Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Catalina espera cubrir sus necesidades y así mismo que mejore un poco su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña ver su negocio más grande y así poder seguir apoyando a  su familia.
  

Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre   del 2013
texts.en:
Young Catalina is a very enterprising person who lives with her husband and children in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business for more than 5 years is a small grocery.  Catalina needs this loan to purchase churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc.  With the loan she hopes to increase her sales by offering more fresh goods to the customers who visit her.

Catalina hopes to cover her necessities and also to improve her economic situation a bit - that is reflected in this investment.  She dreams in a few years to see her business larger and in this way to be able to continue supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras –  November 2013

loans.use: to purcahse churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 3 hijos  y  su esposo. Su negocio es la venta  de Cerdos desde hace 6 años.
Doña Victoria los vende desde su casa de habitación,  necesita el préstamo para la compra de mas cerdos y espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el capital necesarios para seguir trabajando en su negocio, también que su ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren un poco su estilo de vida y el su familia.
Doña Victoria desea que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de la zona aumentar y de esta manera seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  del  2013
texts.en:
Victoria is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her 3 children and husband. She has had a business selling pigs for 6 years.

Vicoria sells them from her home. She needs a loan in order to buy more pigs and she hopes that the loan will help her very much as she doesn't have the capital necessary to continue working in her business, and she hopes that her sales will increase and with this she will earn more income that will improve her family's quality of life.

Victoria wishes that her business grows to become one of the most well-known in the area and in this way continue supporting her children in their education so that they have greater opportunities in life. Choluteca, Hondras - November 2013.






Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre del 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes ella es casada, tiene 51 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia altera sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como arroz y leche para su negocio.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, ganadería y venta de comida.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO.” This bank is located in the district of Cachimayo, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.    
                                                                                                                                                                                         
The borrower is Mercedes, who is 51 years old and married, with two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business, a grocery store. She sells various types of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others. She has dedicated herself to this business for quite a while, and it is going well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts into her work every day. She is a responsible and hard-working person, and in this way she is helping her family get ahead. 

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business. 

The members who appear in the smaller attached photo above asked permission to arrive late at the meeting for work reasons. The other members dedicate themselves to businesses such as selling sweaters, selling clothing, running a grocery store, raising small animals, raising livestock, and selling food. 

The person with her face covered in the photo does not belong to the communal bank. 

The borrower is grateful to those who are contributing to her dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra was born in 1953. She is a widowed woman who lives at a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa with her 2 sons. Her sons sell perfumes. Yusra has been trying her best to support her sons financially after her husband's death. She started her project with a small quantity of blankets and then added selling clothes. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her children in covering their needs. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Akhuryan village. He lives there with his wife and three children (ages 8, 6 and 1). 

Over the last 5 years, Samvel has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. He is the only breadwinner of the family, as his wife needs to take care of their children. So Samvel works hard to be able to cover his family's daily costs. He is now requesting this loan to be able to renovate the car that he drives as a taxi and purchase tires for it. 

Samvel has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Samvel to continue his taxi driving business and he will be able to earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car used as a taxi, and purchase four tires for winter

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 42-year-old, married man, with ten children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the butchery business for 11 years and he does farming as his other income-generating activity. He started this business for personal development and he wants money to buy bulls and goats. He hopes to develop his second plot, even though bad debtors affect him. 

Emmanuel needs the loan to buy bulls and goats to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bulls and goats to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Albrah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Albrah and consists of four members. The members live in Sana`a, Yemen. They all work hard to achieve their goals. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.
Eqbal is 38 years old and is the president of the group. To earn a living, she works as a seamstress. She works hard to grow and continually improve her business. Because her work is recognized as being of good quality, she would like to diversify her business to increase her profits. 
As a result, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 YER from AMB to purchase perfumes and incense to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to run a clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and incense to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Eleuterio resembró gran parte de su parcela gracias a un crédito de Kiva. El está resembrando su terreno para convertir toda su producción a café orgánico. Para esta cosecha nuevamente solicita el apoyo de Kiva con un financiamiento el cual utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes así como para realizar algunas labores culturales en su terreno.
texts.en: During the last harvest Eleuterio replanted a large part of his parcel thanks to a loan from Kiva. He is replanting his land in order to convert all his production to organic coffee. For this new crop he seeks Kiva's support with financing which he will use to buy fertilizer as well as perform farming work on his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm his land.

loans.name: Hamdani

texts.en:
Hamdani runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits and does bill payment services. Hamdani lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. He is married.

Hamdani began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. For the last month, he has had around $5 - $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, he took a loan from Kiva to get a printer to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to print out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Al-Kwasr Group

texts.en:
Al-Kwasr group is located in Hodeidah, Yemen. The group is made up of four ladies.

Makia, 36, is a mother of four children. She works very hard at selling various products such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing, trying to help her husband with the family's daily expenses. She managed to save up a small amount of money, which got her job started.

Due to the meager profit she is making out of it, she is forced to apply for a loan to buy various products such as cosmetic materials, incense, perfumes and clothing to keep her job running and to cover the demands of the season. She expects a boost in her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy various products such as cosmetic materials, incense, perfumes and clothing for her business

loans.name: Meada

texts.en:
Meada and her business personifies all that is part of a successful, unique, ambitious, and ‘do-good’ driven small enterprise.

Meada always wanted to help people and completed her studies with a Technical Diploma in Prosthetics and Orthotics. Since her certification in Iraq in 1991, she participated in further training courses both at home and in Jordan. Her passion to help others, her skills to deliver, and her recognition to the most needed assistance for the people in her area led her to open her own small limbs manufacturing business which she opened in 2009.

The war and continued violence characterized by blasts and bombings have killed many and have left – and continue to leave – even more people with severe injuries and missing body parts. By providing individuals with prosthetics, Meada is assisting adults and children to lead normal lives, participate in everyday activities, attend schools and overcome the challenges of living with physical disabilities, overcome the challenges of dealing with the trauma and remaining signs of horrific past events.
 
Opening the business was not without challenges. Rent was high cost, and the really good quality raw materials for the artificial limbs are extremely expensive. The high costs would have left many without assistance as the final products would have not been affordable to the people most in need. Meada decided to work with less expensive raw materials from Turkey – rather than using the admittedly better quality, but far too expensive German materials.    

Slowly Meada was able to establish her business and started to overcome the initial challenges. She gives much credit to her husband also who has helped greatly at home. Meada and her husband are raising 4 children, and at the age of 42, has the greatest potentials for the future of her business.  She is participating in the WLIFT program, taking a SME business loans and participating in business skills training and mentoring to give her the business skills that match her unique small enterprise.   

She has currently qualified for a $7000 SME loan which she would like to use for purchasing a new, bigger gas oven, as the one she is currently using is an electric one, making work during power cuts difficult. She would like to replace the engine in the Softening Machine used to make the artificial limps more comfortable. With the new, better quality engine the work will be completed faster, reducing the time for orders to be completed, and thereby allowing for more orders to be taken. With the remaining amount she will be able to purchase more raw materials.

Meada has many goals and plans for the further expansion of the business, she would like to eventually add a training room to the prosthesis manufacturing facility, equipped with proper training aids to help people get used to their new prosthesis limbs. In the video she explains with her own words the future plans:

"Peace upon you! I’m specialist Meada from Iraq. I have a Prosthesis Factory, Al-Jawadeen specialized prosthesis center for the physically disabled. I received a loan of $7,000 from Relief International to improve my business. I would like to expand it as my business needs a training hall with equipment for the men and women (for getting used to the prosthesis). We serve disabled adults and children; adults with prosthesis and children with supportive aids. Thank you!"

loans.use: to replace some of the current equipment in her prosthetics factory and buy raw materials

loans.name: Zoilo

texts.es: Zoilo se dedica a la producción de café desde hace unos cuantos años pues y el es socio de la "Unión Regional" que es a donde vende todo su café cada año. Para esta cosecha solicita un crédito que utilizará para el pago de cortadores que contratará para trabajar en su finca. Además de producir café Zoilo también se dedica a la construcción para así tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Zoilo has worked growing coffee for a few years and he is a member of the "Unión Regional" where he sells his coffee every year. For this crop he seeks a loan that he will use to pay the coffee harvesters that he will contract to work on his farm. In addition to producing coffee Zoilo also works in construction in order to have greater income for his family.

loans.use: to pay coffee harvesters.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio de Padua está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Es miembro de este grupo la Sra. Candida, quien vende leche y queso, y de esta forma ayuda a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Ella está luchando y mejorando cada día más por medio de las capacitaciones.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche y queso para poder venderlo y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The San Antonio de Padua group is in its first cycle of the committee for women program, where everyone works and helps one another get ahead.  They are part of the elimination of poverty program and they are completing the survey as a means to eliminate poverty by helping one another.

Candida is a member of the group and sells milk and cheese.  She helps her family in this way, by giving them what they need for a live without deprivation.  She is working to improve every day, with the help of her training.

She is asking for a loan to buy milk and cheese to sell.  I this way she will be able to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad los cuales están estudiando, en la universidad y en secundaria es originaria de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, que desde muy joven ha tenido que luchar en la vida para brindarles estabilidad a sus hijos como padre y madre. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de ayuda económica. Y en la actualidad sigue luchando para poder sobrevivir y mantener su fuente de ingresos. 
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos químicos actividad que la desempeña en sus casa de habitación desde hace 20 años que desempeña dicha actividad, la cual la realiza con mucho gusto ya que ha sido la forma de vida de su familia. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como ambientador de diferentes aromas, cloro, pinesol. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María, 52 years old, is a single mother with two children who are in school, one at university and one in secondary school. She comes from Jinotepe, located in the north of the country. She is known as a hard-working and responsible woman, who from a young age has had to struggle in life to provide stability for her children as both father and mother. Unfortunately, for lack of economic support she could not go to school. Today, she continues her struggle to survive and maintain her source of income. 

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, her economic activity consists of selling chemical products, which she carries out from her home. She has been doing this work for 20 years, and she does it very happily as it has provided her family with a livelihood. She dedicates herself to her business 8 hours a day, offering products like scented air fresheners, chlorine, and Pinesol. 

The goal of this loan is to invest in work capital to stock her store, so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a higher income. María is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, to be able to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in capital and stock her business buying and selling chemical products like air fresheners, chlorine, and Pinesol.

loans.name: Elsa Diner

texts.es:
La señora Elsa  de 36  años de edad es  madre soltera,   tiene  una  hija  que depende  de ella y tiene casa propia, ubicada en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 16  años al negocio de venta de artesanías.
Doña Elsa desde muy joven se ha dedicado a fabricar adornos de barro, su venta es con los turistas que pasan por la zona y con los comerciantes de estos objetos de barro, también vende ropa en los tiempos que no hace los adornos para aprovechar el tiempo y obtener mejores ganancias.
Doña Elsa  está solicitando el préstamo para compra como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas, barro, etc.  Y así aprovechar la temporada navideña  está muy contento de trabajar con Prisma es su cuarto préstamo que solicita y su deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
Doña Elsa  su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 36 year old single mother. She has a daughter that depends on her and she owns her own home which is located in a community in the south of Honduras. For the last 16 years she has worked on her business selling crafts. 

Since she was very young she has worked creating clay ornaments. She sells them to the tourists who pass through the area and to the merchants who sell these items. She also sells clothing during the times when she is not making the ornaments to make use of her time and to obtain better earnings. Elsa is seeking this loan to purchase skirts, dresses, pants, blouses and clay so she can take advantage of the Christmas season. She is very content working with Prisma. This is her fourth loan and her goal is to continue striving to get ahead. Elsa's dream is to improve her business and her quality of life. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, dresses, pants, blouses and clay for her businesses.

loans.name: Arnulfo De Jesús

texts.es: Arnulfo vive con su esposa, quien le ayuda en su negocio propio, se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde reside, es una tienda de abarrotes que lleva aproximadamente 30 años en funcionamiento, ofreciendo todos los productos de la canasta familiar a los habitantes del sector y, gracias a su trayectoria ya es reconocido y muy apreciado; allí trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm; de esta manera ha generado los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar durante 3 décadas. Su empuje, energía y su carisma lo han llevado a lograr todos sus objetivos, por lo que ahora solicita su quinto ciclo de crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, huevos, café, panela, lácteos, carnes frías, galletería, entre otros), así tendrá su negocio bien abastecido para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada decembrina que se aproxima, lo que le permitirá vender más productos y generar mejor nivel de ingresos para seguir solventando las necesidades básicas de su familia y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues Arnulfo sueña con incursionar en otros negocios como un café internet y papelería, pues ve en estas dos actividades una buena fuente de ingresos, con los que podrá disfrutar de una vejez más tranquila al lado de los que ama.
texts.en: Arnulfo lives with his wife, who helps him with his business, located in his home.  He has a grocery store and it’s been there for about 30 years, offering all kinds of food products to the area’s residents.  Thanks to its location, it’s very well-known and appreciated.  He works there every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and has been generating the income to support his family for three decades.  His drive, energy, and charisma have allowed him to complete all his goals and his is asking for his fifth loan to buy products in quantity (pastries, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, brown sugar, dairy, cold cuts, cookies, etc.)  In this way he will be well stocked to satisfy his customer demand during the December season that is nearing and he will be able to generate more income to cover his family’s basic needs and continue to invest in his business.  Arnulfo wants to become involved in other businesses such as coffee, internet, and paper goods.  These are good sources of income with which he can enjoy a nice old age with those who love him.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Laurentino
