texts.en: Leonides, 47, lives with his wife in the district of Pomahuaca, which is in the Cajamarca area in Peru's northern mountains. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. Leonides raises goats. He buys from nearby farms and later sells in the Chiple district, where the best livestock are brought and where cacao is grown. He has applied for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles to maintain his land and buy manure so that he has more production to offer his customers and has more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his cropland.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes su negocio se encuentra en su domicilio, siendo sus clientes vecinos y conocidos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nathalia, age 32, lives with her children in the Pucara district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru.

She sells groceries, and her business is located in her house.  Her customers are her neighbors and acquaintances.  

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to stock her business.  This way she will have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Bleidys Cecilia

texts.es: Bleidys, es una joven emprendedora de 18 años de edad, que actualmente trabaja como empleada en una charcutería, hace aproximadamente un año; pero, motivada por su espíritu de superación y con el interés de generar recursos económicos para aportar al sustento de su hogar, ella desea comprar el establecimiento en compañía de uno de sus hermanos, pues desea aprovechar la oportunidad que su jefe le está ofreciendo para adquirir el negocio; lo que para ella significaría tener una buena fuente de ingresos, y contaría con la ventaja de que el negocio sea reconocido en el sector por la amplia trayectoria que posee. Todo esto la motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito con el que completará el dinero para comprar el negocio y poderlo poner en marcha bajo su administración, adicionalmente requiere remodelar el local y comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, cervezas, confitería, entre otros); con  esto podrá asumir el reto de sacar adelante su propio negocio, con el conocimiento y la experiencia que posee en la actividad. Bleidys es consciente que para lograr sacar adelante su negocio, debe trabajar con esmero, disciplina y mucha responsabilidad, pues de esto depende la rentabilidad de su microempresa y las ganancias que obtiene de ella.
texts.en:
Bleidys, 18, is an enterprising young woman, who has been employed at a delicatessen for about a year. Motivated by her desire to be successful and to make money to support her family, she wants to buy the business with one of her brothers. She wants to take advantage of the chance her boss is offering her to buy the business, which would be a good income source and is well known in the area because it has been open for a long time. 

All of this has led her to apply for her first loan to buy the business and begin managing it, remodel the space as needed, and buy wholesale supplies (sodas, snacks, beer, candy, and more). She would be taking on the challenge of running her own business with the knowledge and experience she has of this work. Bleidys realizes that to make a business prosper, she must be conscientious, disciplined, and responsible, as everything depends on this small business's profitability and the income it generates.

loans.use: to buy the business, remodel the space, and buy wholesale supplies (sodas, snacks, beer, candy, and more).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married mother of two children, both children go to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Caroline has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia lives in New Kru town, she is 23 years old, married, and has three children between 6 months and 11 years old. Only two children are in school and they all live at home. 
Cecelia did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with some business. Presently she is selling rice and soup from a local restaurant to improve their living condition. She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She said less capital is the only challenge she faces now. 
Cecelia likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said she is proud of her business because this is the only way she can help her children. Cecelia said with the loan she is going to buy more fish, meat, pepper, oil, rice, salt, and onion. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more fish, meat, pepper, oil, rice, salt, and onion.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.


For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 


With the KES 50,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Voliet

texts.en:
Meet Voliet.  She is 45 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

For the past 25 years, Voliet has managed her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family's standard of living.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Voliet requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks, such as drinks and pure water, to expand her business. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business.

In the future, Voliet plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the  region of Mbarara in Uganda. He is married and has four children. One of them is currently in school. For the past three years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his model shop, which sells soft drinks, tea, eggs, water, toilet paper and other items. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for business expansion and to buy more items like drinks, water, and eggs. This will help Jimmy to generate greater profits and educate his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more shops. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jimmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy more items like drinks, water, and eggs

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Beatrice was born in Makeni city, 40 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple have 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Beatrice sells market food like tomatoes, onions, salt, and cooking oil. She has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Beatrice and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Beatrice will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy tomatoes, onions, salt, cooking oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, salt, cooking oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Isidoro agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente muy contento por ayuda brindada, él continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de ceviche en su pequeño puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Isidoro sigue participando en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, pescado, sal, camote, maíz entre otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Isidoro is grateful to the lenders for the loan.  He is very happy about the provided help.  He continues with his business of selling ‘ceviche’ [marinated seafood] at his small stand.  

He has been working in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Isidoro continues to participate in his communal bank, and it is going very well for him.

He now needs the loan to buy supplies like limes, fish, salt, sweet potatoes, and corn, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies like limes, fish, salt, sweet potatoes, and corn, among other things.

loans.name: Elias Junior

texts.es:
Elias vive en la ciudad de Camana, trabaja como obrero agrícola en varios fundos de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Elias esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a kerosene, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Elias lives in the city of Camana. He is a farm worker for several municipal organizations. With this income, he supports himself and his family. Elias thanks Kiva lenders, whose help will allow him to buy a gas stove to replace his kerosene stove. This will improve his standard of living and help him realize his great dream: to finish his well-made house.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is 21 years old and lives in Tulkarem. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, as his parents’ income is low, but he didn’t surrender to the conditions. He started working at the structure field, and now he has good experience.


Laith is asking Ryada for this loan to repair his house. He wants to pave the house and make a ceiling in it, which will help to warm his house, especially now in the winter. 


He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du village et ceux des villages environnants. Leur principale activité est le commerce. les membres entretiennent de très bonne relations entres eux.
Rosalie, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle s'investit dans le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis fort longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter une tonne de riz, 04 bidons d'huile de 20 L, 12 paquets de bonbons, 01 sac d'oignon et autres produits. Elle travaille en collaboration avec son mari.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne, d'entretenir sa famille et de prendre en charge ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 22 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on December 21, 2009. It is composed of women from the village and those from surrounding villages. Their main work is in commerce. The members maintain very good ties between themselves.

Rosalie, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 24 years old, married, and the mother of four children, including two boys. She is invested in her business, which she has been working at for a long time. She has very good experience in this domain.

With the loan, she is going to purchase a tonne of rice, four 20-liter containers of oil, 12 packets of candy, a sack of onions, and other products. She works in collaboration with her husband. The profits will enable her to bolster her savings, take care of her family, and support herself.

loans.use: to sell grocery items

loans.name: Santhiaba Mosquee Group

texts.fr: Le Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe est créé le 11 Mai 2001. Il a été constitué sur la base d'affinité et d'entente de  ces membres. Elles ont toujours remboursé leurs prêts à temps sens difficulté. Madame Ndeye Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle s'active dans le domaine de la vente de petit déjeuner depuis plus de quatre année. Elle va acheter en gros avec le prêt sollicité des denrées telles que du petit poids, haricots, oignons, pomme de terre etc... Elle a une clientèle très fidèle. les bénéfices générés par son activité serviront à prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille où elle vit.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' which houses this group was created on May 11, 2001, and it was constituted based on the affinity and understanding between its members. The members have always paid back their loans on time without difficulty. Ms. Ndeye Fatou, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is unmarried and has no children. She has been active  in the domain of selling breakfasts for over four years. 

With the loan requested, she is going to purchase in bulk some supplies, such as peas, beans, onions, potatoes, etc… She has very loyal customers. The profits generated by her business will be used to meet her personal needs and to help cover the expenses of the family in which she lives.

loans.use: to purchase products wholesale to sell breakfasts

loans.name: Henry Paul

texts.es:
Henry Paul tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que se encuentra ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida y jugos en su restaurant sus hijos y esposa le apoyan en esta labor, ubicado en su domicilio es conocido por el buen servicio que ofrece, también brinda servicio de trasporte público en su propia mototaxi.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 800 nuevos soles para arreglar el local de su negocio y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable para acoger a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Henry Paul is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and child in the district of Pucará, two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here are involved in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

For the past 3 years Henry Paul has been selling meals and juice in his restaurant. His wife and his children help him in his work. It is located in their home and is known for it's good service. He also offers transportation services with his own motorcycle-taxi.

Henry Paul has requested a loan of 2800 PEN to fix up the cafe and in this way have an pleasant spot to take care of his clients.

loans.use: to fix up his cafe.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de todo tipo de abarrotes, arroz, leche, huevos, menestras, entre otros, también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores porcinos y pavos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para abastecer su bodega con la compra de productos de primera necesidad y una segunda parte para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: María, 53, lives in the Morropon district, located two hours from the city of Piura on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. María has a store in her house, where she sells groceries like rice, milk, eggs, beans, and more. She also raises and sells small animals like pigs and turkeys. She has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy basic items for her store and to buy feed so that she has more output to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery items and feed.

loans.name: Kely Ruth

texts.es:
Kely Ruth tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida al paso, desde hace más de 10 años, es conocida por la buen gusto que ofrece en cada plato, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles, para la compra de insumos y utensilios de cocina y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Kely Ruth, age 39, lives with her parents in Cayalti, an urban area.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

She has been selling fast food for over ten years.  She is known for the good flavor of each of her dishes.

She has requested a loan for 3,000 soles to buy supplies and kitchen utensils.  This way she will have greater income in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Masafee

texts.en:
40 years old and living in the town of West Point, Masafee is unmarried and has a nine year old child living with her, attending school. For three years now she has been selling charcoal by bag in the local market. She sells from morning to afternoon, from Monday to Saturday. She provides goods on credit to some customers and collects the money later; most interestingly, she does collect her money. 

Masafee has requested a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mariama from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children. For the past 5 years, Mariama has established  a slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support the home. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is 30 years old and from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 2 children.  For the past 10 years, Fatmata has had her established food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support the home. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand the business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 47 years old and she is married. She lives in Sinkor. For the past ten years she has been selling rice by cup in the local market. A challenge that she face is the rainy season. She started this business with money from her mother. She says that handling her own money makes her happy about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. She wants to expand her business to shop business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa, a 20-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged 3 years.  Over the past three years, Hawa established her general store business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's standard of living.    She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of items: cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items: cigarettes, soap, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha sells rice and eggs from her shop in front of the family house, and has more than three years experience in this trade. She is single and has one child, and is responsible for the day-to-day expenses for her child and family, together with her twin sister Mary.

Martha will use her loan of GHS 2,000 to buy more rice and eggs so that she can sell and serve her customers better. 

These products will then be resold from her shop and she wants to increase her earnings to be able to diversify her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and eggs so that she can sell and serve customers better.

loans.name: Fanni

texts.en:
Meet Fanni. She is 35 years old and comes from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2000, Fanni established her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fanni requires a loan in order to purchase more peppers, onions, and tomatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children's education and expand her business. In the future, Fanni plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, onions, and tomatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is a 27 year old from Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Five years ago, Kadiatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet Mabinty. She is 43 years old and from Jui, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 5 children.  In 2007, Mabinty established her green vegetable business. She began her business because she wants to sustain her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more fertilizer and expand her green vegetable business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to change her status of living. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and expand her green vegetable business.

loans.name: Gbombaya Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Gbombaya” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva org. to apply for a loan of 1,800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Marie is the featured leader of this group. The 46-year-old is married to a head teacher and they have 3 children, 2 of whom are attending secondary school. Marie has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market-food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy margi, pepper, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her current products.

(Also included in the right of the picture is Loan Officer Mohamed).

loans.use: to buy margi, pepper, etc. in wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Biram's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 15 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Ce banc villageois regroupe des femmes qui habitent le village et les villages environnants. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. Les femmes entretiennent de très bonnes relations entre elles et sont solidaires.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 04 filles. Elle s'investit dans le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis fort longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle va se faire confectionner 30 paires de chaussures à 1500 F la paire et les revend à 5000 F la paire. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle économise pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants. Avec ses épargnes antérieurs elle a pu acheter un véhicule de transport en commun pour son fils aîné et compte en faire de même pour ses autres enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 15 members is part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on December 21, 2009, and which brings together women who live in the village and in surrounding villages. Their main work involves commerce and raising livestock. The women maintain very good ties among themselves in solidarity.

Fatou, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 42 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, including four girls. She is invested in her business and has been working at it for quite a while. She has very good experience in this domain. 

She is going to have made 30 pairs of shoes at 1,500 per pair and resell them at 5,000 francs per pair. With the profits earned, she will cover her children's schooling costs. She is saving money to ensure her children's future. With her previous savings, she was able to purchase a vehicle [for a taxi business] for her oldest son, and she plans to do the same for her other children.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Actuellement au cycle 03 dans le programme, les femmes qui le composent commence à avoir une bonne maîtrise de leurs activités. Ce groupe se caractérise par les liens forts qui unissent ses membres. En plus du petit commerce les femmes pratiquent l’aviculture et l’agriculture.

Madame Sona (assise à l'extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est très dynamique et d’une volonté sans faille pour la réussite de ses activités. Elle est Mariée et mère de quatre garçons son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits de consommation courante : huile, assaisonnements, oignon et autres divers produits.

Pour ce prêt elle va acheter un bidon d’huile à 16 000 Frs CFA, des paquets de cube d’assaisonnement à 1 300 le paquet, 03 sacs d’oignon de 25 Kg à 30 000 Frs CFA.

Les bénéfices servent à aider son mari dans les charges de la famille ainsi qu’a assurer une meilleure scolarité aux enfants en plus d’accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was set up on October 18, 2012 and is named after the village that houses it. Currently in cycle 3 in the program, the women who compose the group have begun to master their businesses well. This group is characterized by strong ties uniting its members. In addition to small-scale commerce, the women practice poultry farming and agriculture. 

Ms. Sona (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is very energetic and has an unswerving commitment to succeed in her business. She is a married mother of four boys. Her business involves selling typical consumer goods: oil, seasonings, onions, and various other products. 

To do so, she is going to purchase a container of oil at 16,000 francs CFA, packets of seasoning cubes at 1,300 francs per packet, and three 25-kg sacks of onions at 30,000 francs. The profits will be used to help out her husband in covering family expenses, as well as to ensure a better education for her children and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase oil, seasoning cubes, and onions.

loans.name: Mariliz

texts.es: Mariliz agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua vendiendo comida pero también se va dedicar a la venta de chocolates solo por esta campaña navideña, ella sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Mariliz solicita el préstamo para comprar chocolates y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mariliz is grateful to all of the Kiva investors for this loan, and she is very happy for the support that has been offered to her.  

She continues selling food but is also going to begin selling chocolates for the holiday season.  She continues to be a member of the communal bank "Comuzone III" which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  

At this time, Mariliz is requesting a loan to buy chocolates.  She promises to be very responsible in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy chocolates.

loans.name: Evelin Melissa

texts.es:
Evelin Melissa tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun , su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, cerdos , gallinas y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y pavos para ofrecerlos en las zonas aledañas a su comunidad y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Evelin Melissa, age 26, lives with her husband and their two children in the Oyotun district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals; turkeys, pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs in the area behind her house.  She is an enterprising woman.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy pigs and turkeys to sell in the areas outlying her community.  This way she will have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Cruz

texts.es:
Rosa Cruz tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tienen una bodeguita donde ofrece la venta de cerveza, panetones y productos de primera necesidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Cruz, age 51, lives with her husband and children in the Zaña district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has a small grocery store where she sells beer, ‘panetones’ [a type of sweet bread], and basic needs products.  

She has requested a loan for 3,000 soles to stock her business.  This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, ‘panetones’ [a type of sweet bread], and basic needs products.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with three children, only two of whom attend school. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda.


He operates a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise, and he also earns income from a drug shop that is being managed by his wife. 


He plans to finish construction of his residential house and educate his children, though he is challenged by price fluctuations of the products he sells.


Willy is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.

 
With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. 


She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
45-year-old Mabinty lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity. There are few bathrooms, conditions are filthy, and it is over populated. But, the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, traveling is an option, and it has one of the biggest markets in Liberia where food is less expensive.  

She is married, and her husband is a contractor. They both have two children aged 27 and 30. She did not go to school, but she has been running a cook shop (local restaurant) selling rice and soup in the local market. With the loan proceeds she will buy more rice, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onion, vita, etc., to have enough food ingredients in stock. 

With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business. She enjoys her costumers and they boast of her food quality. Her dream is to move from a cook shop to a modern restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onion, vita, etc., to have enough food ingredients in stock.

loans.name: Punos

texts.en:
Meet 12th grade graduate, Punos, who is now a talented businesswoman in Liberia. According to her, she established her business with a little money from her mother. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending ten hours each day on her business. She has been selling plastic dishes such as bowls, plates, cups, pans, tubs, etc., in the local market for eight years now. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and makes lot of profit. 

Punos is requesting a loan to purchase more bowls, plates, cups, pans, tubs, etc. for her business.  Precisely 25 years old, Punos lives in Sinkor. She is still single and has not borne a child. Her plan is to build a house and get married in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls, plates, cups, pans, tubs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is married and has 4 children, aged between 18 and 22. Her children are currently attending school and living at home. Lucia was able to complete 12th grade before starting her business. She has been involved in selling cosmetics in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more cosmetics to resell. She says that fewer goods on her market table is her major problem. With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business, and learned by seeing other businesswomen 10 years ago. She enjoys the flow of customers. Her dream is to move from her table to a shop-based business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María de Jesús es una joven muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante ama de casa y agricultora de 29 años de edad la cual está en una relación en unión libre y madre de tres hijos el mayor está en la primaria y los dos menores que no están en edad para asistir a los centros de estudio. Doña María de Jesús aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres ya que desde muy pequeña los apoyaba en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan en bestia siendo propia la tierra que cultiva gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. Doña María de Jesús en su juventud pudo estudias la primaria completa gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico para la secundaria ya que los gastos eran un poco más y ellos de escasos recursos económicos por lo que no alcanzaba los ingresos para apoyarle en sus estudios más que para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar como alimentación, vestimenta, medicina y con muchas restricciones. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que puedan ser apoyo en sus familias aportando todo lo necesario, comprar un terreno para cultivar una mayor cantidad de café y una mejor variedad. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is a very enterprising young woman with a strong desire to get ahead in life. She is 29, a housewife and a farmer. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children. The eldest is going to primary school, the other two are too young to attend school.
Maria Jesus learned farming thanks to her parents, whom she helped from an early age with the maintenance of the coffee crops. Her crops are located in the same community where she lives and she goes there by beast of burden. She owns the land thanks to an inheritance from her parents.
In her youth, Maria Jesus was able to complete primary education thanks to the support from her parents but could not continue studying due to lack of funding. Secondary level studies were a bit more expensive and her parents had limited resources which didn't allow them to support her studies further, but rather, only to cover basic household needs such as food, clothing, or medicines, and these with many restrictions.
Maria Jesus dreams of providing a better future for her children, with better opportunities and better quality of life so that they in turn will be able to provide for all the necessities of their families. She also wants to buy land to grow more coffee, of a better variety. This is why she is asking for financing so she can improve her crops by taking better care of them through the use of farming supplies such as manure, fertilizer, coffee formula and fungicides that will prevent bug infections and illnesses.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, 30 years old and coming from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2006, Aminata established her snacks business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more eggs, cooking oil and chicken to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, cooking oil and chicken to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet Fatu. She is 46 years old and comes from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  Over the past four years, Fatu has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted create a source of income to support her children.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Fatu requires a loan in order to purchase different kinds of items such as corn, salt, cucumbers and farm seeds to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatu plans to open a cookery shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of items such as corn, salt, cucumbers and farm seeds to  expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is a 35 year old and from Jui, which is east of Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  In 2007, Kadiatu established her green vegetable business. She began her business because she wants to sustain her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fertilizer and expand her green vegetable business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and expand her green vegetable business.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet Rugiatu. She is a 37 year old from Jui, which is east of Freetown. She is married with 3 children. In 2003, Rugiatu established her green vegetable business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more green vegetables and cooking seasoning for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Meet Gloria, she is 48-old from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 4 years, Gloria has been running her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Gloria requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap making business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Gloria plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap-making business.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet Mariatu, she is 35-old from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children.  For the past 10 years, Mariatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create a source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand the business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap making business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to change her business to a provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap to expand her soap making business.

loans.name: Songdé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Songdé, s’active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis cinq ans maintenant. Il possède une boutique qu’il a ouverte à l’aide d’une épargne qu’il a longtemps mis de coté. Songdé a grandi dans le commerce car il restait à coté de son père qui vendait dans une boutique c’est d’ailleurs là qu’il a appris le métier. Il vient solliciter pour la première fois l’appui de l’IMCEC afin de bénéficier d’un financement pour l’achat de riz, huile, sucre et divers autres petites marchandises se vendant en boutique. Il s’en sort pas mal parce c’est une boutique d’origine qui a duré la bas et qui connait une clientèle fidèle.
 Avec les bénéfices de l’activité, il gère la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Monsieur Songdé, souhaite étendre son magasin et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Mr. Songde has been in the food trade business for five years now. He has a shop he opened with savings he had long put aside. Songde grew up in the trade beside his father who had a shop. That’s also where he learned the business. 

For the first time, he is requesting the support of IMCEC to receive funding for the purchase of rice, oil, sugar and various other small goods that he sells in his store. He is doing well because it is an original shop that has lasted there and has a loyal clientele.

With the profits of the business, he manages the family’s daily expense. Mr. Songde would like to expand his shop and diversify his products.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff for his shop: oil, sugar, rice and various other goods.

loans.name: Jairo Jose

texts.es: Jairo es originario de la ciudad de Tipitapa, tiene 39 años de edad.  Soltero y sin hijos a cargo. Es de oficio mecánico, se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al taller de mecánica. Inicio este negocio a la edad de 18 años, desempeñándolo en  varias empresas. Luego, comienza a trabajar en el local actual, gracias a las recomendaciones de sus amigos. Tiempo después sus amigos renuncian y él se queda a cargo, de forma alquilándolo. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio prospero. Su meta es comprar repuestos y herramientas para su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: tuercas, mangueras, líquido de frenos, llantas entre otros, con el fin de brindar un servicio de calidad. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que obtendrá lo necesario para su negocio y así mejorar cada día en su local, sobre todo incrementar su clientela. Su plan futuro es comprar un terreno y construir su casa y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jario is from the city of Tipitapa.  He is 39 years old, single and has no children.  He is a mechanic who puts lots of effort into his workshop.  He started this business at age 18 and has worked for a number of companies but now works from a fixed,rented, location thanks to his friends’ recommendations.

His business is successful and his goal is to buy replacement parts and tools.  He is asking for this loan to buy nuts, hoses, brake fluid, tires, and other things so that he can provide quality service.  He feels that this loan will be helpful to his business and he will be able to improve his shop and customer service above all.  His plans for the future are to buy land and build a house so he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Stella

texts.es: Stella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella ya no continua con el negocio de cafetería pues ahora se está dedicando a la venta de productos nutricionales y le está yendo muy bien, ella continua participando en el banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería o sea productos nutricionales.
texts.en:
Stella is grateful to all the investors for this loan, and she is very happy for the support that has been offered to her.  

She is no longer involved with her cafe business.  Currently, she is very dedicated to selling nutritional products and it is going very well.  Stella still participates as a member of the Asociación Arariwa communal bank.

At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to buy nutritional products.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramón tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de maestro de obras de construcción, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, cascos, guantes, y moldes de construcción y de esta manera seguir ofreciendo dicho servicio de una manera segura.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon is 46 years old and lives in the region of Morropon.  The people in this region work in agriculture, commerce, and in raising livestock.  It is located two hours from the city of Piura, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Juan Ramon is a general contractor.  He is seeking a loan of 1000 nuevos soles so that he can buy tools, helmets, gloves, and construction molds. With these items he can continue safely offering his services.

loans.use: to buy tools for use in construction.

loans.name: Segundo Bernardo

texts.es:
Segundo Bernardo tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, gallinas y cerdos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, desde hace 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposa lo ofrecen en el mercado de la zona.

Segundo ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción y una segunda parte para la compra de más animales para posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Segundo Bernardo, age 47, lives with his wife and children in the Nueva Arica district.  The population there works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He has been raising and selling small animals; turkeys, chickens, and pigs in the area behind his house for ten years.  With his wife’s help, they sell them at the market in the area.

Segundo has requested a loan for 2,501 soles to buy balanced feed.  This way he will have better production.  He will use part of the loan to buy more animals in order to later sell them for a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, café y cacao, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes leche, arroz, menestras, cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de recargas claro, su esposa le apoya en esta labor.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de panetones, vinos, arreglos navideños entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertila is sixty years old and lives with her daughter in the district of Pucará, which is located two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountain region of Peru.  The people here make a living growing fruit, coffee, and cocoa, running shops, and raising livestock. 

She has a grocery store where she sells items like milk, rice, and beans.  This small shop is located in her own home.  She also makes a living selling prepaid phone cards.  Her husband helps her with this work.

She has requested a loan of 4,000 soles to stock her business; she will buy Christmas cakes, wines, decorations, and other items.  In this way, she will be able to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy Christmas cakes, wines, and decorations.

loans.name: Varbah

texts.en:
Varbah is 45 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single with two children, ages 10 and 21. Both of her kids are going to school and live at home. 


Varbah was able to complete twelfth grade, and she is a potential businesswoman who manages her business well. She manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 


Over the past twenty years, she has been selling slippers in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her mother. She sells for six days in every week, spending ten hours each day with her business. 


She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Isatu from Jui, Eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed and has 1 child.  For the past 10 years, Isatu has been running her food stand business. She began her business because she wanted to create better daily living conditions for her child. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She is worrking very hard as she has the desire to improve her standard of living.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase variety of rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and she lives in Paynesville South. She is married to a local businessman. She was unable to attend school before going into business. She describes herself to be a skillful businesswoman. 

Martha explained how she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market, which helps to provide some money for her living. She has been operating this business for the past five years now. She started this business by selling for her mother. She makes lots of money from her business and she has more customers. 

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in the Paynesville South Area, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 50 years old, divorced, and has eight children between 20 and 35 years of age. Three are still in school and live at home. 

Sarah did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with business. She sells salt, pepper, onion, etc. in the local market in order to improve her living conditions. 

She started this business with a little money from her late mother ten years ago, and she has learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because it is profitable. 

With the loan, she is going to buy more salt, pepper, onion, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more salt, pepper, onion, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Khayry

texts.ru: Хайри родилась в 1960 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она более 30 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница, картофель и морковь. Она имеет большой опыт. Хайри основная кормилица семьи. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она в течение года делает два раза посева. Осенний посев и Весенний посев. Хайри должна сделать посев пшеницы, но не имеет достаточно денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Khayry was born in 1960. She is married and is raising four children. For over 30 years, she has been growing crops such as wheat, potatoes, and carrots; she has a significant amount of experience. Khayry is the main breadwinner of her family. Her husband helps her in the development of her business. 

Throughout the year, she sows her crops twice - in the fall and in the spring. Khayry needs to plant wheat, but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers; she is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni. Khayry appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Woude

texts.fr:
Ce femme a pu acquérir une expérience très appréciable dans le petit commerce qui constitue son activité principale, elle s’active dans le commerce. Elle est animé d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel au sein de son groupe. 

Elle est une femme qui a su au fil des cycles développer son activité et ainsi accéder au second produit du programme. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et un garçon. Son commerce s’inscrit dans la vente de patte d’arachide, d’huile de palme, de sucre et du thé vert.  Pour se faire elle compte acheter des graines d’arachide non décortiquées pour la transformation en patte d’arachide.

 Ce nouveau prêt, elle l’utilisera exclusivement à l’achat de sac d’arachide à 5 000 Frs CFA le sac.

Avec des bénéfices de 13 000 Frs CFA par semaine, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion du foyer et de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This woman was able to acquire a very valuable experience in the small trade business, which is her main activity. She is active in trading.  A spirit of mutual help and mutual support within the group animates her.

She is a woman who has been able to expand her business over several [loan] cycles and thus gain access the second product of the program. She is married and the mother of four children with three girls and one boy. Her business is the sale peanut paste, palm oil, sugar and green tea. To do so she has to buy unshelled groundnuts for processing into peanut paste.

She will use this new loan exclusively for the purchase of peanut bags, at the cost of 5,000 CFA francs per bag.

With profits of 13,000 CFA francs a week, she will be supporting her husband in managing the household expenses and the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy exclusively bags of peanut costing 5,000 CFA francs per bag.

loans.name: Emerita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Emérita, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos los cuales están estudiando. Ella se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol, es una actividad que realiza desde hace mucho que ella era joven, hoy es la forma que tiene de generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. Con el apoyo de su esposo ha evitado tener problemas en realizar esta actividad.
Con el crédito comprara abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, lo cual le ayudara a preparar la tierra y sembrar sin inconvenientes, espera aumentar su producción, tener una cosecha libre de plagas, aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar el capital que se le ha prestado.
Sueña con ampliar el área de siembra, mejorar la alimentación, salud y darles a sus hijos una educación superior.
texts.en:
Emérita is 31 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and their children, who are in school. She grows corn and beans, work that she has done for a long time, since she was young. Now it is the means she has to generate income to support the household expenses. With the support of her husband, she has avoided having problems in carrying out this work.

With the loan she will buy compost, pesticides, and insecticides, which will help her to prepare the land and plant without any difficulties. She hopes to increase her production, have a harvest free of pests, increase her earnings, and pay off the money that has been lent to her.

She dreams of expanding her planting area, improving the diet and health of her children, and giving them a superior education.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Fredy Isai

texts.es:
Fredy, se decidió por otro crédito debido a los buenos resultados que ha tenido, en está ocasión surtirá el inventario de su negocio para estar atento a las demandas de los clientes en estas fiestas de fin de año. Invertirá en la compra de pulseras, anillos, cadenas. Con lo que espera seguir teniendo satisfechos a sus clientes.
 Con el crédito anterior el aumento sus ventas sus ingresos son mayores, lo que le permitió cancelar muy bien el crédito y cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy decided that because of the great results from his previous loan, he would like to invest again in his business so that he can meet the demand of his customers for the holiday season.  He will invest in the purchase of watches, rings, and chains. His goal is to continue to satisfy his customers.

With his previous loan, his sales increased and his income also increased.  He successfully paid off his loan and was able to change his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy watches, rings, and chains.

loans.name: Linner Bladimir

texts.es:
Linner Bladimir tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedican al cultivo de frutales, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de comida preparada desde hace 4 años, tiene clientela reconocida en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, frutas y ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Linner Bladimir is 25 years old. He lives in the district of Pucará. His community is involved with growing fruit, trade and livestock. It's two hours from Jaén, located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has sold prepared food for four years. He has grateful customers in the region. He requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles in order to purchase soft drinks, candy, fruit for his customers. He can generate greater profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks, candy and fruit to stock his business.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL NACIENTE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Vilma ella es conviviente, tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia altera sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como arroz y azúcar para su negocio.

La socia que salen en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesania, venta de computadoras, fotocopiadoras, tienda de abarrote, restaurante, venta de productos naturales, salón de belleza, brindando el servicio de taxi, docente,
trabajadores del sector público y privado.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the group "SOL NACIENTE." They are located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

The member named Vilma is married, she is 46 years old, and she has 3 children.  She runs a grocery shop and works daily.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items like these.  She sells the goods to customers that arrive at her store.  She enjoys this work and it as gone well thanks to the hard work she puts in each day. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy supplies such as rice and sugar for her business.

The member in the separate photo above asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because she had to work.

The other members work in various businesses such as crafts, computer sales, photocopy sales, general stores, restaurants, natural product sales, beauty salons, taxi services, docent services, and public and private sector employees.

The member is thankful for everyone that is contributing to her dream and she promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as rice and sugar, for her business.

loans.name: Ana Yaneth

texts.es:
Ana, es una persona dedicada a su familia, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 10 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, es empleada, debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo pera generar más ingresos que cubran las necesidades de su hogar emprendió su negocio de venta de medicinas, lo atiende de 2:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., no es un negocio difícil de administrar y por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizarlo.
Con la inversión la utilizara para comprar vitaminas, reconstituyentes, ungüentos, tés, etc., de origen natural y químico, lo que le permitirá tener mucha variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ana Espera mejorar sus ventas, tener ingresos que necesita para cancelar la deuda y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar.
Aspira a tener un negocio más rentable, mejorar su economía y brindar a su familia un ambiente más sano, seguro y lleno de oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ana is very dedicated to her family.  She is married and has two children that are 6 and 10 years old.  She lives with her husband and their children.  She is employed because she needed to help her husband by generating more income to pay the household expenses.  Therefore, she learned how to sell medicine.  She works from 2:00 AM until 8:00 PM.  It is not a difficult business to run and currently she does not have a problem running it.

With this loan she will buy natural vitamins, tonics, ointments, teas, etc. which will enable her to provide a variety of products for her customers.  Ana hopes to improve her sales and to generate income that will help pay off debt and cover the household expenses.

She aspires to have a successful business, to improve her economic situation, and to provide her family with a safe, secure environment filled with opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, tonics, ointments, teas, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Ijevan town with her husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and Anna works at local market as a cleaner. They work hard to gather income for sustaining their minimal living conditions.
Because of current financial difficulties Anna and her husband are facing, Anna also wants to increase her work. She rented a small room in the market which she wants to use as a bathroom and rent it to market visitors. The area that she chose needs to be improved. 
So, Anna has applied for this loan to be able to pay for improvements and start her new business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Anna and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for improvements

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata; she is 45 years old from Jui Eastern Area in Freetown. She is married with four children. 

In 2000, Aminata established her green vegetable business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her survival. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, gari, and to expand her green vegetable business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Aminata plans to open a big food stand table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, gari and to expand her green vegetable business.

loans.name: Reynaldo Bismarck

texts.es: Don Reynaldo se dedica a su mini ferretería, que ha formado con muchos esfuerzos, también a la par vende productos básicos de uso doméstico en su casa de habitación, su esposa se encarga del negocio cuando el hace trabajos de electricidad a domicilio, de esta manera se ayuda para cubrir los gastos de colegio de su hija y del hogar junto a su esposa. Reynaldo solicita apoyo de crédito con el fin de invertirle a este negocio que es el sustento del hogar, actualmente carece de productos para ofrecer a su clientela y con el financiamiento  abastecerá de productos el negocio.
texts.en:
Reynaldo runs a small home-based hardware shop - which he opened with lots of efforts- and next to it, he also sells basic household commodities. In addition, he also performs electrician jobs, and while he is away working at the clients’ homes, his wife takes care of the business. 

These are helpful sources of income to help cover tuition fees of their daughter’s education, in addition to cover the house expenses. 
Reynaldo is requesting a loan to invest in his business because it currently lacks enough inventory to offer to his customers. He plans to use the loan to invest in supplies to stock the business.

loans.use: to buy wire, power outlets, keys, PVC materials, and various tools.

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.ru: Бахтинисо добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1965 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она имеет свой земельный участок. Она выращивает малину. Бахтинисо этим бизнесом более 20 лет. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она полученный доход использует для развития домохозяйства. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес. Бахтинисо запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения для земли. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ей развевать бизнес и улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahtiniso is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1965, is married and has four children. She owns her own plot of land, and grows raspberries. Bahtiniso has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Her husband assists her in the operation of her business. 

Bahtiniso uses her income for the development of her household; she wants to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers for her land; the loan will help her to develop her business and improve her standard of living. She is thankful for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1964 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она живет в сельской местности. Саида занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница и другие зерновые культуры. Саида имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она основная кормилица семьи. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Саида всегда старается улучшить условию проживания для своих детей, но она данное время не имеет денег, чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. Саида запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Saida is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1964, is married, and has two children. She lives in a rural area. Saida grows crops such as wheat and other grain crops, and makes an additional income from animal husbandry. She is the primary breadwinner in her family, and her husband helps her with her business. 

Saida is always trying to improve her children's living conditions, but currently does not have enough money to repair her house. She is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni in order to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. for home renovations. She is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela nació en la provincia de Canas pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche y otras cosas más, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes implementada con la necesidades básicas.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar, ella en sus horas libres también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales y a otras actividades pues le va muy bien. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Graciela was born in Canas Province, but currently lives in the city of Salvación. The city of Salvación is located in the District of Manu in Manu Province, which is situated within the Department of Madre de Dios in Peru.

Graciela is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who helps her family get ahead. Her main business activity is selling basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, and other items. She has a small grocery store that is stocked with these basic necessities. Graciela has been in business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Tesoritos del Manu" (The Little Treasures of Manu). Graciela is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar. In her free time, she also grows crops and raises animals. She is doing very well in these other activities. Graciela appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store, such as sacks of rice and sugar.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inaugurer l’installation du banc villageois est la réalisation d’un vœu d’accéder au crédit pour l’ensemble des membres du groupement. Afin de mener des activités génératrices de revenu axées sur le petit commerce.
 
Madame Fatoumata  (assise dans la deuxième rangée à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée  et mère de 09 enfants dont 04 filles et 05  garçons. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits de consommation courante : sucre, thé vert, épices et divers autres produits. Elle achète sa marchandise dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revente dans son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter un sac de sucre, un paquet de thé vert et des épices.

 Les bénéfices, elle compte accroître son épargne dans le sens de bénéficier de prêt plus important dans le futur.
texts.en:
The newly inaugurated installation of the banc villageois is the fulfillment of a wish of all the group members to access credit. In order to carry out income-generating activities focused on small business.
 
Ms. Fatoumata (sitting in the second row on the far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 55 years old, married and mother of nine children with four girls and five boys. She sells various every-day products: sugar, green tea, spices and various other goods. She buys her supplies in weekly markets for resale in her village.

With the new loan, she wants to buy a bag of sugar, a box of green tea and spices.

With the profits, she intends to increase her savings in order to benefit from larger loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, a box of green tea and spices.

loans.name: Javier Alexander

texts.es:
Javier Alexander tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una zona rural de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, elaboración y comercio de dulces y ganadería, a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de chivos y carneros desde hace más de 5 años, es conocido en la zona por el rubro al que se dedica, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la zona.

Es un joven emprendedor tiene la oportunidad de vender sus animales en los caseríos aledaños por lo que ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio lo que le generara mayores ingresos para contribuir con sus padres.
texts.en:
