He is hopeful that he will attain this if he is given the loan money amounting to 1,000,000 UGX.

loans.use: to buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in the Senaki district. She is 52 years old, married and lives with her daughter, son-in-law, grandchild and husband. The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They breed four milk cows and make cheese which is sold at the local open market. 

Tina and her husband, Rauli, decided to start a new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the loan, Tina will purchase a car and Rauli will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a Taxi business

loans.name: Le Bon Berger De Sable Group

texts.fr:
Roseline est le coordinatrice de son groupe Le Bon Berger de Sable. Elle est mariée elle a 4 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité n’est rare et de l’eau portable n’est très limite.  Elle dispose d'un salon de beauté.

Elle dirige son commerce de salon de beaute pendants les 8 dernières années. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Le Bon Berger de Sable ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de cosmétiques, charbon, boissons gazeuses etc. 

Elle déclare que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans le département du nord est. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Roseline is the coordinator of her group "Le Bon Berger de Sable". She is married and has four children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. She has a beauty salon.

She has been running her beauty salon for the last eight years. She hopes this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members of Le Bon Berger de Sable have need of a loan for businesses, such as selling cosmetic products, charcoal, carbonated beverages, etc. 

She says that her main challenge is to become a greater merchant in the northeast district. She says her main goal is to have a big business that will facilitate the construction of a big house, with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 65 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos y su nieto en su casa propia. El trabajo de Lola consiste en la venta de productos comestibles. Tiene su pequeño negocio instalado en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo a cumplir esta función y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Trabaja sola mientras realiza algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad con la ayuda de su hijo. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 5 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que produce sus ingresos económicos sin que esto le demande un excesivo esfuerzo, además tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a su pequeño nieto con sus tareas escolares. Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en un futuro en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Con El monto solicitado de S/. 3000 comprara productos comestibles tales como 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, cajas de leche chica, pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina, galletas, conservas de atún, embutidos y otros productos.
texts.en: Lola is 65 years old and a very hard-working woman. She's single and has two children. She lives with them and her grandson in a house that she owns. Lola's line of work is selling foodstuffs. She owns her small business which is set up in her home. She works on this trade full-time and she's very happy with her sales. She works alone and at the same time she does some basic household chores. She stocks her business on a weekly basis by going shopping with her son in the commercial centres downtown. She has been in this line of work for five years. What she enjoys about her work is that it yields profits without her having to work too hard. Besides, she has time to help her little grandson with his schoolwork. She has been doing well, since she makes good profits which allow her to make her repayments in a timely fashion. She hopes to be able to expand her business and start saving so that in the future she can invest in home improvements. With the requested amount of 3,000 nuevos soles she'll purchase foodstuffs such as a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, small milk cartons, bread, eggs, cooking oil, plantains, onions, flour, crackers, canned tuna, cold cuts and other merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.en: Mahmadullo was born in 1953 year. He is a hardworking man who always tries to improve living condition for his family. He has been busy with taxi service more than 20 years. Mahmadullo lives and works in the South part of Tajikistan. His working day began at 6 o’clock and lasted till late night. Mahmadullo has great experience in this field. He works hard but he makes a little income. Mahmadullo must organize the marriage party of his son but he has not enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to make wedding party. He awaits your support.

loans.use: organize his son's wedding party

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. Thy is a primary school teacher in a local school of Pursat province. She teaches small children, who are between the age of 6 and 13 years old. Thy is able to earn a decent income, but it is hardly enough to cover her daily costs.,So, Thy also works as a part-time teacher to earn additional income. She has been in this occupation for more than 15 years.

Since Thy doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, she has requested a loan of US $1,000 dollars to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, Thy is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 40s, is married and has five children who are still going to school.  She has been running two businesses, selling fried fish and fresh milk for three years now. She works from 4 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy more fish and milk to resell. She has a dream of owning a hotel.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Unity," which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and milk to resell.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel is 33 years old lives with her husband and 3 children in a traditional nomadic yurt in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband Monhbold sells firewood and charcoal in local market. Her older 2 children study at local schools and youngest daughter goes to local kindergarten. 
Narangerel has been running small meat products sales business in local market since 2003 with her husband. In order to increase family income her husband started firewood and charcoal retail business. She is now requesting loan of 3,000,000MNT to purchase large amount of meat products from herders and sell at her counter to local residents. She is hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders and sell at her counter to local residents

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David  tiene 31 años de edad, vive en concubinato desde hace 6 años al norte de Colomi, tiene un hijo dependiente que aún está estudiando. Es agricultor y cultiva en terreno de sus padres con rotación de cultivos, su fuente de ingresos proviene de la venta de papa y locoto, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado vacuno. Por la falta de recursos económicos solicita un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico  y productos agroquímicos, porque sus cultivos que están en proceso necesitan mantenimiento  y control fitosanitario, así podrá tener un cultivo sano con mejores resultados de producción.
texts.en: David is 31 years old and has lived with a partner for 6 years to the north of Colomi.  He has a dependent child who is still in school.  David is a farmer who cultivates on his parent's land, rotating crops.  His source of income comes from the sale of potatoes and locoto peppers.  He also has some cattle. Because he lacks financial resources, he is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products.  He needs these because his crops that are in progress need maintenance and phytosanitary control.  This way, he will have a healthy crop and a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money for business expansion. 

Janepher is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables and bananas for resale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables and bananas  for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
This is Gladys, 38, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Her partner is Cesar and they have one child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Gladys maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Gladys hopes to expand her business and have more customers. She dreams to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With this loan, she is requesting Kshs 20,000 to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she is appreciative for the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Anabel tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y legumbres en diferentes tianguis desde hace 15 años.

Anabel pone su puesto en diferentes tianguis de sábados a jueves, descansando los viernes. Trabajan con ella cinco jóvenes que le ayudan con la venta de verduras y legumbres.  Pide este préstamo para mejorar su casa, la cual requiere instalación de puertas, ventanas y algunos acabados.
 
Gracias a su trabajo Anabel ha logrado estar estable con su familia en lo general, aunque con algunas altas y bajas. Su reto es seguir adelante con su negocio, dar trabajo a más gente y en su momento le gustaría tener un negocio en un lugar fijo; ya no estar en tianguis.  Le interesa abrir su cremería o verdulería.
texts.en:
Anabel is a Kubo Financiero customer, and this is her story:
She is 39 years old, and married with three children. She has fifteen years of experience in the business of selling greens and other vegetables in different open-air markets.

Anabel sets up her stall in different markets from Saturday to Thursday and rests on Friday.  Five young people work with her and help her sell her vegetables. She is requesting this loan to improve her home, which needs windows and doors to be installed. This work is nearly done.

Thanks to her work, Anabel has managed a measure of security for her family in general, although there have been some highs and lows. Her goal is to continue getting ahead with her business, provide work for more people, and one day to have a business set up in a fixed location instead of working in the open-air markets. She is interested in opening a dairy or produce shop.

loans.use: improve her home by installing doors and windows.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz, age 37, is a married woman and the mother of two children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 44 year old vigorous lady, and she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old vigorous lady and the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Saima requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier income. Saima is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Kouser is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health.

To make her store fully stocked, Kouser requested a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es una mujer muy amable siempre esta de muy buen humor pero sobretodo es una persona muy trabajadora muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene 44 años de edad está casada  desde hace 25 años con el señor Rosendo quien trabaja en su propio taxi, juntos formaron una familia con tres hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja. Doña Esperanza se dedica a la elaboración de gorros, bufandas, guantes, capas, calentadores y medias  de estambre desde hace 38 años plática que desde  los 7 años tenía un gran deseo por iniciar a bordar pero no tenia material para aprender sin embargo se las ingenio para tener un estambre. “Un día tome un suéter y unas tijeras de mi mamá, busque un buen lugar para esconderme y cortar el suéter de mi mamá y así obtener estambre, el gancho ya lo tenia me lo encontré en la calle rumbo a mi escuela” Doña Esperanza estaba muy contenta porque ya tenia estambre, pero su mamá se encontraba disgustada  porque era su suéter favorito y Doña Esperanza lo había destruido. “Mi mamá me regaño por lo que había hecho, pero finalmente me compro estambres de colores para iniciar a bordar”. En ese momento no sabía bordar pero aprendió de unos familiares que también se dedicaban a la elaboración de artesanía toan solo con verlos. Cuando ya tenía varias piezas a esa misma edad inicio a salir a las ciudades grandes para vender su artesanía y con sus primeras ganancias le repuso el suéter a su mamá. Y desde entonces se ha dedicado a elaborar productos bordados para la temporada de fríos todo el año trabajan pero las épocas buenas son en el invierno desde hace 6 años está fuera de su casa por una temporada larga porque en el lugar donde vive sus artesanías se las pagan muy baratas y en otros lugares es mejor remunerada. Esta vez están solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA  para comprar estambre y también más mercancía pero de otro material porque también se los solicitan sus clientes porque no les gusta el estambre, porque muchas veces si alguno de sus clientes le solicita un articulo especial necesita elmaterial, la combinación y modelos son creatividad de Doña esperanza  para realizar alguna prenda solo necesita de algunos minutos para tenerlos listos. El único  reto de Doña Esperanza es la falta de dinero para invertir un poco mas porque el material ya es muy caro por eso mismo el préstamo será de gran ayuda para su negocio. Doña Esperanza comento “Me hace muy feliz continuar con mi actividad me gusta mucho creo que tengo el don de elaborar los bordados”. El sueño de Doña Esperanza es poder terminar sus locales que tiene en su casa para prestárselos a una de sus sobrinas y junto con ella para arrancar nuevos negocios pero también quiere comprar animales para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Doña Esperanza, 44, is a friendly, good-natured woman, but she's serious about her work.  She and her husband, Rosendo, have been married for 25 years and have three grown children.  Rosendo has his own taxi business and Doña Esperanza has operated a knitwear products business for 38 years.  She makes hats, scarves, gloves, etc. and tells us that she decided at 7 years old to learn to knit even though she had no materials to practice with.  "One day, I took a sweater and a pair of scissors, found a place to hide and cut up the sweater--my mother's!--to make the yarn I needed."  Doña Esperanza was happy with the result, but her mother less so because it was a favorite sweater.  "My mother scolded me for ruining the sweater, then bought balls of yarn in different colors so that I could start knitting in earnest."  She learned by watching relatives who had businesses similar to the one that she has now and when she had pieces good enough to sell, she sold them in the market.  And she used the money that she made from her first sales to buy her mother a new sweater.  She has earned a living from making and selling knitted products ever since.  She works year-round, but knitwear is most in demand during the winter when it's coldest.  Local prices for her products are low so, for the last 6 years, she has sold what she makes in other parts where buyers pay more.  Doña Esperanza is applying to VisionFund and Kiva for a loan that she will use to buy yarn and the other supplies that she needs to continue her knitwear business.  She designs all of her creations and only needs a few minutes to make them, but her materials are expensive and she needs help to buy them.  The loan will be a great help to her, she says: "It makes me happy to know that I can carry the business forward . . . I enjoy it very much and think that I have a gift for making the products that I make".  For the future, she wants to finish renovating space for shops at her house that she can loan to her nieces for businesses that they can operate together. She would also like to set up an animal-sales business that would generate an extra income.

loans.use: to stock her knitwear business.

loans.name: Yrma Rosa

texts.es:
Yrma Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores patos, cerdos, gallinas, pavos y cuyes en la parte posterior a su domicilio, es conocida en la zona, lo distribuye por los caserios aledaños a su comunidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para construir una granja de cerdos en un terreno cerca a su domicilio y así ofrecer su producción a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yrma Rosa is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the district of Oyotun, where people work in agriculture, trade, and cattle ranching. They live two hours from Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells young animals out of the back of her home, including ducks, pigs, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs. Her business is well known in the area, and her distribution ranges throughout the neighboring villages in her community.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to build a barn for her pigs on some land near her home. This way she will be able to offer her products to her customers, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: build a barn for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera pero es padre y madre para su único hijo, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en esta misma ciudad, ella se dedica a la brindar hospedaje y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sabanas, toallas, champús y otras cosas más. Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Maribel is 32 years old. She is a single parent, both mother and father to her only child. She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the city. She works in the hospitality industry and it's going very well for her. She currently has an opportunity that will require her to take out a loan to purchase sheets, towels, shampoos, and other products. She thanks her investors for this loan and is committed to making her payments responsibly.

loans.use: purchase sheets, towels, shampoos and more for her hotel.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn is a 48-year-old married man. His family consists of him, his wife and three children. Together, they live in a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province.  To be a responsible father and a breadwinner of the family, Noeurn is involved in farming and construction. He commonly grows rice in the rainy season and works at construction sites during the dry season. Asides from his hardships, Noeurn is able to provide enough food for the household and send his children to school.

His current house has deteriorated over the years, Noeurn is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 4,000,000 to buy woods for home renovations. He hopes that he will be able to provide a suitable living condition for his family members through the loan support. Noeurn expresses his thanks to all lenders who have contributed their loan to help poor fellow like him to develop his living status.

loans.use: to buy wood for home renovations.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
This is Flordeliza, 46, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Flordeliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells herbal medicine and religious items for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Flordeliza dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zohidjon

texts.en:
Zohidjon is married and has children. He has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 5 years ago began own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, now that her children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. 
In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which allowed him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a child, Jenny participated in food and nutrition competitions where she had to learn about vegetables – memorize them by size, smell, texture, and density – and put together menus with the food pyramid to make well-balanced meals.

In her hometown of San Antonio, Texas, the now 34-year-old Jenny creates and sells decorated cookies, cakes, other baked goods and baskets out of her bakery where nothing is pre-ordered and everything is made-to-order. Her first job was in a cake shop. But later, thinking she would be more “practical”, she went to college and ended up at a desk job where she remained for several years. She didn’t like it! And she never stopped thinking about her love of cooking and baking. So she finally decided to make a career out of her passion.

Since the start of her business in 2013, Jenny has offered specialty cakes and fresh-baked goods out of her in-home business, "Jenny Jane’s Bakery". As the sole employee, Jenny noticed a need to increase her customer base by moving the business out of her home and into a facility. Before her loan, Jenny restricted her business to only people she knew to ensure her safety. She now leases a large building on a major street in San Antonio and is expecting her business to grow. The building also allows for a potential restaurant or party venue.

Before completing the transition, Jenny searched online for small business lenders and learned about Accion Texas Inc. The nonprofit microlender helped her meet the demand of customers by giving her the ability to purchase a commercial fridge, baking supplies and equipment and allowed her to market her business. Jenny predicts the loan will not only increase the amount of business but also permit her to create jobs in her community. As the bakery grows, she plans to hire at least one part-time employee.
.
Currently, Jenny is completing her website which will have consultation sheets, operation times, information on some of the different menu items, flavors, prices, samples, FAQs, and more. Look for it by mid-December 2013 at www.jennyjanesbakery.com

loans.use: to purchase a commercial fridge, baking supplies and equipment and market her business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 31-year-old married lady and the mother of five children. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, Bushra contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her production. It will help her to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 34-year-old married lady and the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is single with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a tea leaves business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a big business in the near future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase 4 sacks of tea leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a number of regular clients. She is motivated to provide for her family. Because she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 31-year-old vigorous married lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Carlos Oniel

texts.es: El señor Carlos a sus 27 años de edad, es casado padre de un hijos en edad escolar,su esposa trabaja como domestica para una casa privada, el labora como ayudante de Cocina para un restaurante de la capital, su mayor sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda quien con mucho esmero esta levantando, el credito lo solicita para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro etc. Agradece el apoyo que le han brindado ya que su familia podra gozar de mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Carlos is 27 years old. He is a married father of school-aged children. His wife works as a servant in a private home. He works in the kitchen of a restaurant in the capital. His greatest dream is to be able to finish construction on his home that he has been building with great dedication. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy cement, sand, iron, and so forth. He is grateful for the support he has received since it has brought his family much better living conditions.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Sangam

texts.en:
Sangam is 53 years old and married with six children, three of whom are married and the rest are enrolled in school. Sangam is a farmer who learned to work in agriculture from her parents when she was very young. Her husband is in the same business, farming rice alongside her on more than one hectare of farmland in Pursat province. Having been in the business for years, Sangam is able to earn a normal income of $5.00 per day, which goes for meals, home bills and school allowances for her children.

Currently, Sangam’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this regard, she would like to acquire a loan in the sum of 1,000 US dollars to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Kanharath

texts.en:
Kanharath, aged 20, comes from a rural village in the Tram Kak district, Takeo province. Recently, she has begun temporarily living with her aunt in Phnom Penh because she is attending Cambodian Mekong University, majoring in marketing. This is her second academic year at university and it’s time for her to pay her tuition fees again in order to start her course. 

Due to insufficient money, Kanharath would like to borrow a loan amounting to 700 USD to pay for her university tuition fees. As her education is being subsidized by her parents, she aims to have a part-time job to help her parents share the costs of living and pay for her university fees. Kanharath is very happy and grateful for the loans funded via programs like Kiva that enable poor students to pursue a higher education, and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Don Jacinto viven una comunidad muy tranquila, la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías como chalecos, colchas, mochilas etc, en este tipo de prendas plasman figuras relacionadas con la cultura mazahua. La fiesta más sobresaliente es cuando celebran a Santa Ana. Don Jacinto tiene 32 años de edad  está casado con la señora Fabiola, juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos, Don Jacinto tiene un taxi desde hace cinco años, platica que lo inició porque no tenía un trabajo estable todos sus trabajos eran temporales, pensó que iniciar a dar servicio en su taxi sería muy buena opción porque no había otras personas ofreciendo este servicio anteriormente no tenía todos los sus papeles en regla pero gracias a su primer crédito otorgado por VisionFund lo pudo regular ante las autoridades. Don Jacinto está muy contento porque es sueño cumplido porque ahora puede transitar libremente por su comunidad y municipio, Aunque la dificultad más grande es la competencia porque en los últimos meses se están abriendo muchas bases de taxis. Esta vez Don Jacinto solicito un crédito para invertirlo en refacciones para su taxi pero también una parte lo utilizara para comprar veladoras y flores por la celebración del día de muertos, “Estoy seguro que me ira muy bien en la venta de estos artículos en esta época”. El único sueño de Don Jacinto es poder seguir conservando su taxi y obtener buenas ganancias para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y asegurar de alguna manera los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jacinto lives in a very peaceful village where most of the people make handcrafts such as vests, quilts, backpacks, etc. On these apparels they feature designs related to the Mazahua culture. The most prominent feast is when Santa Ana is celebrated. Jacinto is 32 years old. He's married to Fabiola, and together they have made a family with two children. Jacinto has owned a taxi for the past five years. He started this business because there were no other people providing these services. At first he didn't have all his papers in order but thanks to his first loan with VisionFund, he was able to legalize his business with the authorities. Jacinto is very glad to see his dream come true, because now he can drive freely around his community and his town. However, his biggest difficulty is the competition, since several new taxi stands have been opening in the past few months. This time Jacinto requested a loan in order to use it to purchase spare parts for his taxi. However, he'll also use part of it to purchase candles and flowers to celebrate the Day of the Dead - "I'm sure that I'll do very well selling these items during this season". Jacinto's only dream is to be able to maintain his taxi and make good profits. That way he'll continue to improve his family's living conditions and somehow ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts, as well as flowers and candles for the Day of the Dead.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 20 years old and lives with her family. She is studying at the university. In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well-known business in her town. 

Her previous loan was used to pay her tuition for the first semester, as well as cover the cost of books and study materials. Recently, she has requested a new loan to pay the school fees for the second semester.

She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her second semester

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon Tansa is a 40-year-old man who is married to Tolfiana, a 36-year-old woman. They are blessed  with 4 daughters: Intan, 17, in the 3rd grade of Senior High School; Rini, 11, and  Melda, 10, who are both Elementary School students; and Grace, who is 3 years old. 

Simeon has been running a kiosk business with his wife for 7 years. Simeon is also an employee at a store. His wife assists him by managing the kiosk business as he works at the store. They started the business by using their own capital to build the small impermanent kiosk. Day by day their kiosk business is growing, and they are so thankful for the 1st cycle loan they received from TLM as they grow their business. 

Nowadays their kiosk has become a permanent kiosk with more stuff to sell. In order to add more stock for a Christmas sale, Simeon is applying for an individual loan in the amount of IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on soft drinks, flours, sugar, etc. to be sold in their kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, flours, sugar, etc. to be sold in their kiosk.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene un salón de belleza, en donde realiza trabajos de peinados, ondulaciones, pintado de cabellos, desde hace tres años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domiclio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de tintes, shampo, acondicionador, mascarillas entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 29 years old. He lives in the Oyotun district, a rural area where most people work in agriculture, trade, and cattle ranching, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He has a beauty salon where he does hair styling, permanents, and dye jobs. He has done this work out of his home for three years.

Julio is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, facial masks, and more products. He hopes to generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: purchase hair dyes, shampoo, conditioner, and facial masks for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She sells used clothes but still with good quality and she was able to buy more from her suppliers. Her loan also helped in the education of her child. Her income from the business is supporting their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a piggery for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolina dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family will have a better living. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps a lot in learning from the Bible. Before becoming a member of CCT, Carolina never opened her Bible, but she does now as it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is a young and very nice lady aged 27 who for the second time wants to deal with a generous Kiva lender. She lives in the village of Tsovagyugh which is in the Gegharkunik region. Her mother is alone and is very skillfully engaged in farming: her father still lives and works in the Russian Federation from where he supports his family. Heghine works at a school and is still studying at the State Pedagogical University of Armenia to receive her master's degree, which is very important so she can always have constant and well-paid work.
 
Heghine is asking for a loan of 150,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her tuition fee, since the savings that she has managed during several months are still not enough.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee since her savings over several months are still not enough

loans.name: María Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Herlinda tiene 50 años, vive en unión libre desde hace 25 años y tiene 3 hijos de 34, 21 y 14; sólo la más chica depende de ella y estudia la secundaria. Vive en casa propia, a nombre de su esposo  Jaime, quien se dedica a operar un taller. Ella vende productos de limpieza, zapatos por catálogo y productos de belleza con la ayuda de dos amigas.

Inició hace un año 4 meses con la venta de zapatos, ya que su hija sacó una tarjeta adicional e inició un sistema de tandas para el calzado. Los productos de limpieza  los vende desde hace 8 meses y los surte a unas cuadras de su domicilio, yendo 2 veces por semana. Tiene muchos clientes debido a sus precios accesibles y a la recomendación de la gente que ya le ha comprado y vecinos.

Este préstamo lo quiere para agrandar su negocio de productos de limpieza, dándole una mejor presentación para tener mayores ventas.  Gracias a su negocio Herlinda ha tenido mayores ingresos para solventar sus gastos y tener una mejor calidad de vida, para ella su principal reto es ampliar su negocio y tener productos surtidos.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a Kubo Financiero customer, and this is her story:

She is fifty years old, and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner of 25 years. They have three children, aged 34, 21, and 14. Only the youngest child is still a dependent, and is attending high school. They live in their own home, in her husband, Jaime's, name. He runs a workshop. Herlinda sells cleaning products, shoes, and beauty products out of a catalog with the help of two friends.

She began selling shoes four months ago when her daughter took out an additional bank card and started a batch system for the footwear. She has sold cleaning products for eight months and stocks them a few blocks from her home, going twice a week. She has many customers thanks to her affordable prices and the recommendation of her friends and previous customers.

She wants this loan to expand her business of selling cleaning supplies, using the money to improve the presentation of her products, which she hopes will lead to greater sales. Thanks to her business, Herlinda has had more income to meet her household expenses and enjoy a greater quality of life. Her main goal is to expand her business and keep products in stock.

loans.use: improve how her merchandise is displayed for sale.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been in the beauty parlor business for the past nine years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move towards a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 41-year-old married woman. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
At the age of 60, Shamshad is a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Richlove

texts.en:
Richlove is a young entrepreneur who has been able to manage her loans correctly. She used her previous loans to invest in a second-hand clothing business. On this occasion with this loan request of GHS 1,300, she will buy different styles, colors and sizes of clothing.

Richlove hopes sales will increase during the Christmas season so she can earn enough to repay the loan and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy different styles, colors and sizes of clothing

loans.name: El Amanecer De Callahuanca Group

texts.es: Los socios (as)  del grupo “NUEVO AMANECER DE CALLAHUANCA” se encuentran muy contentos por encontrarse pasando el 04 ciclo. Marina tiene 61 años es casada con 05 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica al cultivo de palta y chirimoya juntamente con su esposo. Las frutas que producen los venden al mercado de frutas y en su vivienda en donde a la vez vende gaseosas y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es abrir su bodega restauran. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Marina es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The members of the "Nuevo Amanecer de Callahuanca" group are very happy to be on their fourth loan cycle.  Marina is 61 years old, married, and has five grown-up, independent children.  Marina makes a living growing avocados and custard apples alongside her husband.  The couples sells their fruits at the fruit market and in their home, where they also sell sweets and fizzy drinks.  Marina's biggest wish is to open her own restaurant.  Marina will use this loan to buy fertilisers to improve the quality of her crops.  The "Nuevo Amanecer de Callahuanca" group thanks Kiva lenders for this loan.  In the photo, Marina is the first on the left.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Olipa, who is in her early 30s, is married with four children who still go to school.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past four years. She works from 8 a.m. to  6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Olipa's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of second-hand clothes.  She has been very successful and happy with the loan. Olipa gives thanks to all who have supported her Wazo Tegeta group.  She has successfully repaid all her loans.  She used the profit to pay school fees and helped her husband to cover household expenses. Olipa will use this loan to increase her stock of second-hand clothes.  She dreams of owning a very large second-hand clothes business.

Olipa will share this loan with her loan group, Wazo Tegeta, which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Alma Rosy

texts.es: Alma Rosy tiene 28 años de edad está casada con Gabino desde hace cinco años juntos han formado una familia con una pequeña de apenas un añito que lleva por nombre Nicole. Alma vive en una comunidad muy tranquila pertenece a una zona mazahua donde algunas personas aun conservan su lengua materna, sus tradiciones, Alma es muy alegre y amable pero sobretodo la caracteriza su artesanía que realiza  Ella comento: “Desde pequeña aprendí a elaborar este tipo de artesanía porque mi mamá me enseño a elaborar aretes, collares, anillos, llaveros, gargantillas entre otras cosas en plata, me hizo partícipe de la actividad desde muy pequeña”  Alma inicio solo con una onza de plata realizando solo algunos artículos pequeños para venderlos  y con sus ganancias compro mas métal para incrementar su producción. Alma, junto con su esposo ahora se dedican a realizar sus artesanías para ofrecerlas en varias galerías y así exponer sus joyas pero también desea difundir la cultura mazahua en otros lugares plasmando figuras acorde a sus tradiciones en su artesanía. Desde hace seis años Alma y su esposo han ido adquiriendo su herramienta  para elaborar sus artesanías, Alma comento: “Para elaborar unos aretes nos tardamos dos días aproximadamente, el primer día  se funde la plata y se prepara para fundir la plata en alambre o lamina, en el segundo día se diseña y se suelda con una herramienta especial” Alma es reconocida ya por varias exposiciones, galerías y fomento de instituciones privadas para poder vender su artesanía. El reto que presenta Alma es la falta de capital para comprar sus herramientas para hacer más fácil la elaboración de sus artesanías para después poner un buen taller donde pudiera enseñarle a otras personas como ser unos buenos artesanos  aunque el sueño más grande de Alma es poder llegar a tener una tienda artesanal donde vendiera piezas exclusivas.
texts.en: Alma Rosy, 28, and her husband, Gabino, have been married for five years and have one child, a daughter, Nicole, who is barely one year old.  Alma lives in a quiet rural town in a traditional Mazahua area where local people have held on to their language and traditions.  Alma is a friendly, good-natured woman, but serious about the craft products that she makes: "I learned to make these when I was just a girl . . . my mother made silver earrings, necklaces, rings, key chains and other silver craft products and I learned at her knee".  Alma started with just an ounce of silver and slowly built her business by using her earnings from the products she made to buy more silver and make more elaborate products.  Alma says that she and her husband make a living making and selling her products and that she values the chance to teach others about Mazahuan culture.  She has been buying tools for making her products for six years and says: "Making earrings takes us about two days, the first to smelt and shape the silver and the second to solder the loose pieces together to create the final design".  Alma's work is well-known at the shops, fairs and craft markets where she sells her products.  Her immediate obstacle is a lack of money to buy the tools she needs to set up a workshop where she could train others to become artisans.  Her dream, though, is to open a shop where she would sell her own exclusive pieces.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

location.town: Localidad Plateros, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Elfer Bilardo

texts.es:
Elfer tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a esposa en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de trasporte público de pasajeros en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes por las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir trabajando con seguridad, generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elfer, 28, and his wife live in Pucará, about two hours from Jaen, a city in the mountains of northern Perú. Local people depend on fruit farming, animal-rearing and other small businesses.

Elfer owns a mototaxi and earns his living carrying passengers to and from surrounding towns. He is applying for a 1,000 new soles loan that he will use to pay for maintenance work. The investment will allow him to work safely and, in turn, generate the income he needs to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Isidora

texts.es:
María Isidora tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, cerdos, gallinas, patos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de pavos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Isidora is 55 years old. She lives with her husband in the Cayalti district, where people generally work in agriculture, trade, and cattle ranching, located two hours from Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She is in the business of raising and selling young turkeys, pigs, chickens and ducks out of the back of her home. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy, in part, nutritionally balanced feed, and also to buy turkeys. In this way she will earn greater income for her family.

loans.use: buy young animals and nutritious feed for them.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in the village of Dashtakar which is in the Ararat region. She graduated from the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute and since then she has worked as a teacher at a school in Vedi city. She is devoted to her work and to her teacher’s degree. Hasmik is married and she has three children; all of whom are already married. Hasmik’s husband provides veterinary services in their village. 

The couple are engaged in farming, in addition to their employment. On their farm, they have a cow, two calves, a bull and 20 chickens. Now Hasmik greatly wants to increase the number of cows on her farm which will allow her to sell more milk and other dairy products and receive a good income. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy several cows and also increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy several cows and also increase her family income

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik and his family have decided to have their second deal with Kiva lenders. 

It is very hard for Garik both to provide for his not-small family and also to pay for his daughter’s education. 

Garik, now in his own garage, is engaged in car-repairing activities, but since he is the only bread-winner in his family, he hardly earns enough for his family's living. 

Garik’s wife is not employed. His elder daughter is married, and she lives with her family.  His son is school-age.  His second daughter is a student at the Vanadzor Branch of the Armenian-Russian International University in the Jurisprudence Department.

Garik is asking a loan of AMD 180,000 in order to pay his daughter’s tuition fee for her second year.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s tuition for the second year

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence lives in Kilifi county which is north of of Mombasa Kenya.He operates a business that deals with hiring plastic seats for events like weddings and meetings. He has been in the business for years now he wants to move the business to the next level. He also does poultry farming and the business has been growing over the years. He seeks a loan to buy 50 plastic chairs for his business. He knew Milango through friends who asked him to join so that he could get access to funding for the business. He has had previous loans from Milango and he has been able to repay without challenges. the income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy 50 plastic chairs

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a 51-year-old vigorous married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and needles to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and needles

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop.  Over the time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet her household expenditures.

Currently, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Rubeena

texts.en:
Rubeena, 33 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store business for the past three years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.

In order to avoid shortages, Rubeena needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Rubeena has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 26-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 25,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu.  She is 35 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with four children. 

In 2000, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is high competition in the market.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari (made from cassava) for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari for resale

loans.name: Erika Rachel

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 23 años de edad, se graduó de Bachiller en Computación pero no ejerció la carrera decidiendo ayudar a sus padres en sus cultivos de café y se dedicó a trabajar con él. Su estado civil es en unión libre y de esa relación junto a su compañero de hogar tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha salido adelante ya que su pareja hace 6 meses tuvo un accidente automovilístico en el cual quedo invalido. Hace unos meses lo operaron de la columna pero no tuvo resultados positivos, desde entonces ella se ha dedicado a trabajar sola en sus cultivos de café lo que se le ha hecho muy difícil ya que ella tiene que hacer todo el trabajo y en ocasiones los hermanos de ella le ayudan pero no es permanente solo cuando ven el trabajo acumulado. Sus padres le enseñaron como se cultiva el café y adquirió los conocimientos requeridos para trabajar y generar ingresos para ella y su familia los cuales los ha aprovechado al máximo. Ella tiene 4.5 manzanas en total, 2.5 productoras y 2 en plantía de las cuales unas son herencia de sus padres y otra parte la compraron haciendo un esfuerzo ubicada a 25 minutos de donde ella vive. Ella se trasporta en vehículo, y se lleva las personas que le colaboran para la corta de café y luego por la tarde las va a dejar nuevamente al punto de encuentro. Unos de los desafíos que ella tiene es que la gente se aproveche porque ella es mujer, y que el intermediario no le compre el café a un precio justo 
Por lo que ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para lograr obtener una excelente cosecha y pueda mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
Erika tiene como meta mejorar sus ingresos económicos para salir adelante ella y su familia, y así poder comprar más propiedades para seguir cultivando más y apoyar a su esposo para lograr una segunda operación y que pueda volver a caminar. Como madre heredar a su hijo y lograr asegurar su futuro para que pueda ser un profesional y una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Erika is a young woman who's 23 years old. She has a technical degree in computer technology but decided to help her parents with their coffee crops, and began to work on that. She's in a common law marriage and from this relationship with her live-in partner she has a 2-year-old son. She has been getting ahead with a great deal of effort, since six months ago her partner was in a car accident that left him disabled. A few months ago he had surgery on his spine but the results weren't positive. She has been working on the coffee crops alone ever since. This has been very difficult, because she has to do all the work. Occasionally, her siblings help her out, but it's not permanent - only when the work gets piled up. Her parents taught her to grow coffee. She acquired the knowledge she needed to work and get an income for herself and her family, and she has made the most of it. She owns a total of 4.5 manzanas, of which 2.5 are in production and 2 are being sowed (1 manzana equals about 1.740 acres). Part of the land she inherited from her parents and part of it they purchased by making an effort, and it's located 25 minutes away from where she lives. She gets around in a vehicle and picks up the people who help her reap the coffee, then in the afternoon she drops them off again at the meeting point. One of the challenges she faces is that people may take advantage of her because she's a woman, and that the middleman may not buy her coffee at fair prices. That's the reason why she requests a loan from COMIXMUL in order to purchase farm supplies with which she'll maintain her coffee crops. That way she'll have an excellent harvest and she'll be able to increase her profits for the sake of her family's well-being.
Erika's goal is to improve her earnings so that she can get herself and her family ahead, and therefore be able to buy more land in order to keep on growing more crops. She also aims to be able to help her husband get a second operation so that he can walk again. As a mother, she aims to leave her son a legacy and ensure his future so that he can become a professional and a decent person.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies so she can maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es:
Luis  es un hombre casado de 50 años de edad,  padre de ocho hijos  de los cuales 4 ya están casados y los otros cuatro aun viven con sus padres, dos de ellos están estudiando y las otras dos ayudan a su madre en los oficios de su hogar.
El es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente presta el servicio de taxi en su comunidad, ya que es una manera de transportar a sus clientes de un lugar a otro. El ha elegido esta actividad porque obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables, como también comenta que es maestro de obras de construcción, lo cual lo realiza en sus tiempos libres ya que es otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,300.00 para la compra de repuestos para su taxi y de esta manera podrá mejorar el servicio que presta a sus clientes.
Su sueño es incrementar más sus ganancias para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a married man, fifty years old, and the father of eight children. Four are married and the other four still live at home with their parents. Two are students and the other two help their mother with the housework. 

He is a hard-working man who fights for the well being of his family. He currently works as a taxi driver in the community, carrying his customers from one place to another. He chose this line of work because it earns him sufficient income. He also remarked that he is a supervisor on construction projects, which he does in his free time as an additional source of income.

At this time, he is requesting a loan for 5,300 quetzales to buy spare parts for his taxi. This way he will be able to improve the service that he provides to his customers.

His dream is to increase his earnings to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es: Encarnación agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua trabajando elaborando tejidos y trabajando como empleado de hogar, Encarnación solicita el préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca para elaborar chompas para su negocio.
texts.en: Encarnación asked us to thank you for extending this loan to her and says that she is grateful for your support.  She still makes a living from both selling the knitted products she makes and from cleaning houses.  Encarnación is applying for a loan that she will use to buy alpaca wood for making the sweaters that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her knitting business.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobos a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de leña para braseros, lo distribuye en una unidad alquilada por las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ocasionalmente se desempeña como obrero.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una mototaxi de segunda y de esta manera distribuir su producto, ahorrándose el alquiler de movilidad, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto, 45, and his wife live in La Matanza, a rural area known for its carob forests. La Matanza is about two hours from Piura, a city in north coastal Perú and local people depend on farming, animal-rearing and other small businesses.

Alberto operates a business selling firewood. He carries it to the surrounding towns in a rented vehicle. He earns extra income by working as a day laborer.

Alberto is applying for a 3,000 new soles loan that he will use to buy a used mototaxi. The investment will allow him to save the cost of renting a vehicle for carrying firewood to his customers and, by extension, increase the money he can make to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for carrying the firewood he sells.

loans.name: Yuliana Araceli

texts.es:
Yuliana Araceli tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora, piqueos y gaseosas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, en ocasiones realiza reuniones en un rancho de la comunidad donde ofrece venta de comida preparada por ella misma.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora maíz, azúcar y una segunda parte para compra de carnes rojas, plátanos, yucas para la elaboración de seco de chavelo y así generar mayores para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yuliana Araceli is 35 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires district, two hours from Piura, on Peru's northern coast. In Yuliana's town, the people make a living in farming, running businesses, and raising cattle.

Yuliana makes a living selling beer, corn liquor ("chicho de jora"), snacks, and fizzy drinks.  Yuliana's business is in her own home and, on occasion, she also sells her products, as well as food that she has prepared, at a local park.

Yuliana is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy supplies for making her corn liquor and to buy sugar, red meat, plantains, and yucca, in order to prepare "seco de chabelo" (a traditional meat dish) and so earn a higher living to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and the supplies to make corn liquor.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 29 years old, and he lives with his retired mother in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. Davit has graduated from the Vanadzor Branch of the Armenian-Russian International University, the department of Government and Management. 

Now he works at the rescue team as a fireman-driver. He also has the rank of sergeant of the rescue team. And he says he realizes the seriousness and the importance of his work, and he feels great responsibility each time they receive a call of help. 

The house, where his mother and he live, needs to be repaired.  Davit wants very much to improve the living conditions for his beloved mother.  So he is asking a loan of AMD 400,000 in order to start repairing his house.

loans.use: to start repairing his house to make things easier for his mother

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Vanadzor town with her husband, mother-in-law, and 1-year-old son. She has been involved in the retail business for 13 years. Particularly, in rented small store, Anush trades with pickles and cheese. Her mother-in-law helps Anush with making high quality pickles and cheese. She sells them with her husband. Due to this family's hard work over these years, they were able to gain a good reputation among buyers as a high quality provider. 

Now, for being able to increase sales, this hard working family needs financial support. Anush has applied for this loan to be able to purchase containers, raw materials for making more pickles and cheese, as well as to be able to renovate the store. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a big support to this family and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for containers, raw materials, and renovating her store.

loans.name: Agnes's

texts.en:
Meet Agnes’s.  She is 48 years old and from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child.  

For the past 11 years, Agnes’s has managed her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to maintain her family's source of income.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Agnes’s requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Agnes’s plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 28-year-old from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged 5 years. In 2003, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira lives in the village of Gamarjveba. She is 25 years old, married, and lives with her husband, in-laws, and two school-aged children. Zaira works as a saleslady at the local food market and gets a small monthly salary (on average $120 per month). 

Zaira and her husband, Paata, decided to start a new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low incomes. With the loan, Zaira will purchase a car and Paata will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand car for her husband to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
